19 /**
20 \file TFile.cxx
21 \class TFile
22 \ingroup IO
23 
24 A ROOT file is a suite of consecutive data records (TKey instances) with
25 a well defined format.
26 
27 If the key is located past the 32 bit file limit (> 2 GB) then some fields will
28 be 8 instead of 4 bytes:
29 
30 Byte Range | Member Name | Description
31 ----------------|-----------|--------------
32 1->4 | Nbytes | Length of compressed object (in bytes)
33 5->6 | Version | TKey version identifier
34 7->10 | ObjLen | Length of uncompressed object
35 11->14 | Datime | Date and time when object was written to file
36 15->16 | KeyLen | Length of the key structure (in bytes)
37 17->18 | Cycle | Cycle of key
38 19->22 [19->26] | SeekKey | Pointer to record itself (consistency check)
39 23->26 [27->34] | SeekPdir | Pointer to directory header
40 27->27 [35->35] | lname | Number of bytes in the class name
41 28->.. [36->..] | ClassName | Object Class Name
42 ..->.. | lname | Number of bytes in the object name
43 ..->.. | Name | lName bytes with the name of the object
44 ..->.. | lTitle | Number of bytes in the object title
45 ..->.. | Title | Title of the object
46 -----> | DATA | Data bytes associated to the object
47 
48 The first data record starts at byte fBEGIN (currently set to kBEGIN).
49 Bytes 1->kBEGIN contain the file description, when fVersion >= 1000000
50 it is a large file (> 2 GB) and the offsets will be 8 bytes long and
51 fUnits will be set to 8:
52 Byte Range | Record Name | Description
53 ----------------|-------------|------------
54 1->4 | "root" | Root file identifier
55 5->8 | fVersion | File format version
56 9->12 | fBEGIN | Pointer to first data record
57 13->16 [13->20] | fEND | Pointer to first free word at the EOF
58 17->20 [21->28] | fSeekFree | Pointer to FREE data record
59 21->24 [29->32] | fNbytesFree | Number of bytes in FREE data record
60 25->28 [33->36] | nfree | Number of free data records
61 29->32 [37->40] | fNbytesName | Number of bytes in TNamed at creation time
62 33->33 [41->41] | fUnits | Number of bytes for file pointers
63 34->37 [42->45] | fCompress | Compression level and algorithm
64 38->41 [46->53] | fSeekInfo | Pointer to TStreamerInfo record
65 42->45 [54->57] | fNbytesInfo | Number of bytes in TStreamerInfo record
66 46->63 [58->75] | fUUID | Universal Unique ID
67 
68 Begin_Macro
69 ../../../tutorials/io/file.C
70 End_Macro
71 The structure of a directory is shown in TDirectoryFile::TDirectoryFile
72 */
73

220 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
221 /// Opens or creates a local ROOT file.
222 ///
223 /// \param[in] fname1 The name of the file
224 /// \param[in] option Specifies the mode in which the file is opened
225 /// \param[in] ftitle The title of the file
226 /// \param[in] compress Specifies the compression algorithm and level
227 ///
228 /// It is recommended to specify fname1 as "<file>.root". The suffix ".root"
229 /// will be used by object browsers to automatically identify the file as
230 /// a ROOT file. If the constructor fails in any way IsZombie() will
231 /// return true. Use IsOpen() to check if the file is (still) open.
232 /// To open non-local files use the static TFile::Open() method, that
233 /// will take care of opening the files using the correct remote file
234 /// access plugin.
235 ///
236 /// Option | Description
237 /// -------|------------
238 /// NEW or CREATE | Create a new file and open it for writing, if the file already exists the file is not opened.
239 /// RECREATE | Create a new file, if the file already exists it will be overwritten.
240 /// UPDATE | Open an existing file for writing. If no file exists, it is created.
241 /// READ | Open an existing file for reading (default).
242 /// NET | Used by derived remote file access classes, not a user callable option.
243 /// WEB | Used by derived remote http access class, not a user callable option.
244 ///
245 /// If option = "" (default), READ is assumed.
246 /// The file can be specified as a URL of the form:
247 ///
248 /// file:///user/rdm/bla.root or file:/user/rdm/bla.root
249 ///
250 /// The file can also be a member of an archive, in which case it is
251 /// specified as:
252 ///
253 /// multi.zip#file.root or multi.zip#0
254 ///
255 /// which will open file.root which is a member of the file multi.zip
256 /// archive or member 1 from the archive. For more on archive file
257 /// support see the TArchiveFile class.
258 /// TFile and its remote access plugins can also be used to open any
259 /// file, i.e. also non ROOT files, using:
260 ///
261 /// file.tar?filetype=raw
262 ///
263 /// This is convenient because the many remote file access plugins allow
264 /// easy access to/from the many different mass storage systems.
265 /// The title of the file (ftitle) will be shown by the ROOT browsers.
266 /// A ROOT file (like a Unix file system) may contain objects and
267 /// directories. There are no restrictions for the number of levels
268 /// of directories.
269 /// A ROOT file is designed such that one can write in the file in pure
270 /// sequential mode (case of BATCH jobs). In this case, the file may be
271 /// read sequentially again without using the file index written
272 /// at the end of the file. In case of a job crash, all the information
273 /// on the file is therefore protected.
274 /// A ROOT file can be used interactively. In this case, one has the
275 /// possibility to delete existing objects and add new ones.
276 /// When an object is deleted from the file, the freed space is added
277 /// into the FREE linked list (fFree). The FREE list consists of a chain
278 /// of consecutive free segments on the file. At the same time, the first
279 /// 4 bytes of the freed record on the file are overwritten by GAPSIZE
280 /// where GAPSIZE = -(Number of bytes occupied by the record).
281 /// Option compress is used to specify the compression level and algorithm:
282 ///
283 /// compress = 100 * algorithm + level
284 ///
285 /// Level | Explanation
286 /// ------|-------------
287 /// 0 | objects written to this file will not be compressed.
288 /// 1 | minimal compression level but fast.
289 /// ... | ....
290 /// 9 | maximal compression level but slower and might use more memory.
291 /// (For the currently supported algorithms, the maximum level is 9)
292 /// If compress is negative it indicates the compression level is not set yet.
293 /// The enumeration ROOT::RCompressionSetting::EAlgorithm associates each
294 /// algorithm with a number. There is a utility function to help
295 /// to set the value of compress. For example,
296 /// ROOT::CompressionSettings(ROOT::kLZMA, 1)
297 /// will build an integer which will set the compression to use
298 /// the LZMA algorithm and compression level 1. These are defined
299 /// in the header file <em>Compression.h</em>.
300 /// Note that the compression settings may be changed at any time.
301 /// The new compression settings will only apply to branches created
302 /// or attached after the setting is changed and other objects written
303 /// after the setting is changed.
304 /// In case the file does not exist or is not a valid ROOT file,
305 /// it is made a Zombie. One can detect this situation with a code like:
306 /// ~~~{.cpp}
307 /// TFile f("file.root");
308 /// if (f.IsZombie()) {
309 /// std::cout << "Error opening file" << std::endl;
310 /// exit(-1);
311 /// }
312 /// ~~~
313 /// When opening the file, the system checks the validity of this directory.
314 /// If something wrong is detected, an automatic Recovery is performed. In
315 /// this case, the file is scanned sequentially reading all logical blocks
316 /// and attempting to rebuild a correct directory (see TFile::Recover).
317 /// One can disable the automatic recovery procedure when reading one
318 /// or more files by setting the environment variable "TFile.Recover: 0"
319 /// in the system.rootrc file.
320 ///
321 
322 TFile::TFile(const char *fname1, Option_t *option, const char *ftitle, Int_t compress)
323  : TDirectoryFile(), fCompress(compress), fUrl(fname1,kTRUE), fInfoCache(0), fOpenPhases(0)
324 {
325  if (!gROOT)
326  ::Fatal("TFile::TFile", "ROOT system not initialized");
327 
328  // store name without the options as name and title
329  TString sfname1 = fname1;
330  fNoAnchorInName = kFALSE;
331  if (sfname1.Index("?") != kNPOS) {
332  TString s = sfname1(0, sfname1.Index("?"));
333  SetName(s);
334  fNoAnchorInName = kTRUE;
335  } else
336  SetName(fname1);
337 
338  SetTitle(ftitle);
339 
340  // accept also URL like "file:..." syntax
341  fname1 = fUrl.GetFile();
342 
343  // if option contains filetype=raw then go into raw file mode
344  fIsRootFile = kTRUE;
345  if (strstr(fUrl.GetOptions(), "filetype=raw"))
346  fIsRootFile = kFALSE;
347 
348  // if option contains filetype=pcm then go into ROOT PCM file mode
349  fIsPcmFile = kFALSE;
350  if (strstr(fUrl.GetOptions(), "filetype=pcm"))
351  fIsPcmFile = kTRUE;
352 
353  // Init initialization control flag
354  fInitDone = kFALSE;
355  fMustFlush = kTRUE;
356 
357  // We are opening synchronously
358  fAsyncHandle = 0;
359  fAsyncOpenStatus = kAOSNotAsync;
360 
361  TDirectoryFile::Build(this, 0);
362 
363  fD = -1;
364  fFree = 0;
365  fVersion = gROOT->GetVersionInt(); //ROOT version in integer format
366  fUnits = 4;
367  fOption = option;
368  fWritten = 0;
369  fSumBuffer = 0;
370  fSum2Buffer = 0;
371  fBytesRead = 0;
372  fBytesReadExtra = 0;
373  fBytesWrite = 0;
374  fClassIndex = 0;
375  fSeekInfo = 0;
376  fNbytesInfo = 0;
377  fProcessIDs = 0;
378  fNProcessIDs = 0;
379  fOffset = 0;
380  fCacheRead = 0;
381  fCacheReadMap = new TMap();
382  fCacheWrite = 0;
383  fReadCalls = 0;
384  SetBit(kBinaryFile, kTRUE);
385 
386  fOption.ToUpper();
387 
388  fArchiveOffset = 0;
389  fIsArchive = kFALSE;
390  fArchive = 0;
391  if (fIsRootFile && !fIsPcmFile && fOption != "NEW" && fOption != "CREATE"
392  && fOption != "RECREATE") {
393  // If !gPluginMgr then we are at startup and cannot handle plugins
394  // as TArchiveFile yet.
395  fArchive = gPluginMgr ? TArchiveFile::Open(fUrl.GetUrl(), this) : 0;
396  if (fArchive) {
397  fname1 = fArchive->GetArchiveName();
398  // if no archive member is specified then this TFile is just used
399  // to read the archive contents
400  if (!strlen(fArchive->GetMemberName()))
401  fIsArchive = kTRUE;
402  }
403  }
404 
405  if (fOption == "NET")
406  return;
407 
408  if (fOption == "WEB") {
409  fOption = "READ";
410  fWritable = kFALSE;
411  return;
412  }
413 
414  if (fOption == "NEW")
415  fOption = "CREATE";
416 
417  Bool_t create = (fOption == "CREATE") ? kTRUE : kFALSE;
418  Bool_t recreate = (fOption == "RECREATE") ? kTRUE : kFALSE;
419  Bool_t update = (fOption == "UPDATE") ? kTRUE : kFALSE;
420  Bool_t read = (fOption == "READ") ? kTRUE : kFALSE;
421  if (!create && !recreate && !update && !read) {
422  read = kTRUE;
423  fOption = "READ";
424  }
425 
426  Bool_t devnull = kFALSE;
427 
428  if (!fname1 || !fname1[0]) {
429  Error("TFile", "file name is not specified");
430  goto zombie;
431  }
432 
433  // support dumping to /dev/null on UNIX
434  if (!strcmp(fname1, "/dev/null") &&
435  !gSystem->AccessPathName(fname1, kWritePermission)) {
436  devnull = kTRUE;
437  create = kTRUE;
438  recreate = kFALSE;
439  update = kFALSE;
440  read = kFALSE;
441  fOption = "CREATE";
442  SetBit(kDevNull);
443  }
444 
445  const char *fname;
446  if ((fname = gSystem->ExpandPathName(fname1))) {
447  SetName(fname);
448  delete [] fname;
449  fRealName = GetName();
450  fname = fRealName.Data();
451  } else {
452  Error("TFile", "error expanding path %s", fname1);
453  goto zombie;
454  }
455 
456  if (recreate) {
457  if (!gSystem->AccessPathName(fname, kFileExists)) {
458  if (gSystem->Unlink(fname) != 0) {
459  SysError("TFile", "could not delete %s (errno: %d)",
460  fname, gSystem->GetErrno());
461  goto zombie;
462  }
463  }
464  recreate = kFALSE;
465  create = kTRUE;
466  fOption = "CREATE";
467  }
468  if (create && !devnull && !gSystem->AccessPathName(fname, kFileExists)) {
469  Error("TFile", "file %s already exists", fname);
470  goto zombie;
471  }
472  if (update) {
473  if (gSystem->AccessPathName(fname, kFileExists)) {
474  update = kFALSE;
475  create = kTRUE;
476  }
477  if (update && gSystem->AccessPathName(fname, kWritePermission)) {
478  Error("TFile", "no write permission, could not open file %s", fname);
479  goto zombie;
480  }
481  }
482  if (read) {
483  if (gSystem->AccessPathName(fname, kFileExists)) {
484  Error("TFile", "file %s does not exist", fname);
485  goto zombie;
486  }
487  if (gSystem->AccessPathName(fname, kReadPermission)) {
488  Error("TFile", "no read permission, could not open file %s", fname);
489  goto zombie;
490  }
491  }
492 
493  // Connect to file system stream
494  if (create || update) {
495 #ifndef WIN32
496  fD = SysOpen(fname, O_RDWR | O_CREAT, 0644);
497 #else
498  fD = SysOpen(fname, O_RDWR | O_CREAT | O_BINARY, S_IREAD | S_IWRITE);
499 #endif
500  if (fD == -1) {
501  SysError("TFile", "file %s can not be opened", fname);
502  goto zombie;
503  }
504  fWritable = kTRUE;
505  } else {
506 #ifndef WIN32
507  fD = SysOpen(fname, O_RDONLY, 0644);
508 #else
509  fD = SysOpen(fname, O_RDONLY | O_BINARY, S_IREAD | S_IWRITE);
510 #endif
511  if (fD == -1) {
512  SysError("TFile", "file %s can not be opened for reading", fname);
513  goto zombie;
514  }
515  fWritable = kFALSE;
516  }
517 
518  Init(create);
519 
520  return;
521 
522 zombie:
523  // error in file opening occurred, make this object a zombie
524  {
525  R__LOCKGUARD(gROOTMutex);
526  gROOT->GetListOfClosedObjects()->Add(this);
527  }
528  MakeZombie();
529  gDirectory = gROOT;
530 }

532 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
533 /// TFile objects can not be copied.
534 
535 TFile::TFile(const TFile &) : TDirectoryFile(), fInfoCache(0)
536 {
537  MayNotUse("TFile::TFile(const TFile &)");
538 }

540 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
541 /// File destructor.
542 
543 TFile::~TFile()
544 {
545  Close();
546 
547  // In case where the TFile is still open at 'tear-down' time the order of operation will be
548  // call Close("nodelete")
549  // then later call delete TFile
550  // which means that at this point we might still have object held and those
551  // might requires a 'valid' TFile object in their desctructor (for example,
552  // TTree call's GetReadCache which expects a non-null fCacheReadMap).
553  // So delete the objects (if any) now.
554 
555  if (fList)
556  fList->Delete("slow");
557 
558  SafeDelete(fAsyncHandle);
559  SafeDelete(fCacheRead);
560  SafeDelete(fCacheReadMap);
561  SafeDelete(fCacheWrite);
562  SafeDelete(fProcessIDs);
563  SafeDelete(fFree);
564  SafeDelete(fArchive);
565  SafeDelete(fInfoCache);
566  SafeDelete(fOpenPhases);
567 
568  {
569  R__LOCKGUARD(gROOTMutex);
570  gROOT->GetListOfClosedObjects()->Remove(this);
571  gROOT->GetUUIDs()->RemoveUUID(GetUniqueID());
572  }
573 
574  if (IsOnHeap()) {
575  // Delete object from CINT symbol table so it can not be used anymore.
576  // CINT object are always on the heap.
577  gInterpreter->ResetGlobalVar(this);
578  }
579 
580  if (gDebug)
581  Info("~TFile", "dtor called for %s [%lx]", GetName(),(Long_t)this);
582 }
583 
584 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
585 /// Initialize a TFile object.
586 ///
587 /// \param[in] create Create a new file.
588 ///
589 /// TFile implementations providing asynchronous open functionality need to
590 /// override this method to run the appropriate checks before calling this
591 /// standard initialization part. See TXNetFile::Init for an example.
592 
593 void TFile::Init(Bool_t create)
594 {
595  if (fInitDone)
596  // Already called once
597  return;
598  fInitDone = kTRUE;
599 
600  if (!fIsRootFile) {
601  gDirectory = gROOT;
602  return;
603  }
604 
605  if (fArchive) {
606  if (fOption != "READ") {
607  Error("Init", "archive %s can only be opened in read mode", GetName());
608  delete fArchive;
609  fArchive = 0;
610  fIsArchive = kFALSE;
611  goto zombie;
612  }
613 
614  fArchive->OpenArchive();
615 
616  if (fIsArchive) return;
617 
618  // Make sure the anchor is in the name
619  if (!fNoAnchorInName)
620  if (!strchr(GetName(),'#'))
621  SetName(TString::Format("%s#%s", GetName(), fArchive->GetMemberName()));
622 
623  if (fArchive->SetCurrentMember() != -1)
624  fArchiveOffset = fArchive->GetMemberFilePosition();
625  else {
626  Error("Init", "member %s not found in archive %s",
627  fArchive->GetMemberName(), fArchive->GetArchiveName());
628  delete fArchive;
629  fArchive = 0;
630  fIsArchive = kFALSE;
631  goto zombie;
632  }
633  }
634 
635  Int_t nfree;
636  fBEGIN = (Long64_t)kBEGIN; //First used word in file following the file header
637 
638  // make newly opened file the current file and directory
639  cd();
640 
641  if (create) {
642  //*-*---------------NEW file
643  fFree = new TList;
644  fEND = fBEGIN; //Pointer to end of file
645  new TFree(fFree, fBEGIN, Long64_t(kStartBigFile)); //Create new free list
646 
647  //*-* Write Directory info
648  Int_t namelen= TNamed::Sizeof();
649  Int_t nbytes = namelen + TDirectoryFile::Sizeof();
650  TKey *key = new TKey(fName, fTitle, IsA(), nbytes, this);
651  fNbytesName = key->GetKeylen() + namelen;
652  fSeekDir = key->GetSeekKey();
653  fSeekFree = 0;
654  fNbytesFree = 0;
655  WriteHeader();
656  char *buffer = key->GetBuffer();
657  TNamed::FillBuffer(buffer);
658  TDirectoryFile::FillBuffer(buffer);
659  key->WriteFile();
660  delete key;
661  } else {
662  //*-*----------------UPDATE
663  //char *header = new char[kBEGIN];
664  char *header = new char[kBEGIN+200];
665  Seek(0);
666  //ReadBuffer(header, kBEGIN);
667  if (ReadBuffer(header, kBEGIN+200)) {
668  // ReadBuffer returns kTRUE in case of failure.
669  Error("Init","%s failed to read the file type data.",
670  GetName());
671  delete [] header;
672  goto zombie;
673  }
674 
675  // make sure this is a ROOT file
676  if (strncmp(header, "root", 4)) {
677  Error("Init", "%s not a ROOT file", GetName());
678  delete [] header;
679  goto zombie;
680  }
681 
682  char *buffer = header + 4; // skip the "root" file identifier
683  frombuf(buffer, &fVersion);
684  Int_t headerLength;
685  frombuf(buffer, &headerLength);
686  fBEGIN = (Long64_t)headerLength;
687  if (fVersion < 1000000) { //small file
688  Int_t send,sfree,sinfo;
689  frombuf(buffer, &send); fEND = (Long64_t)send;
690  frombuf(buffer, &sfree); fSeekFree= (Long64_t)sfree;
691  frombuf(buffer, &fNbytesFree);
692  frombuf(buffer, &nfree);
693  frombuf(buffer, &fNbytesName);
694  frombuf(buffer, &fUnits );
695  frombuf(buffer, &fCompress);
696  frombuf(buffer, &sinfo); fSeekInfo = (Long64_t)sinfo;
697  frombuf(buffer, &fNbytesInfo);
698  } else { // new format to support large files
699  frombuf(buffer, &fEND);
700  frombuf(buffer, &fSeekFree);
701  frombuf(buffer, &fNbytesFree);
702  frombuf(buffer, &nfree);
703  frombuf(buffer, &fNbytesName);
704  frombuf(buffer, &fUnits );
705  frombuf(buffer, &fCompress);
706  frombuf(buffer, &fSeekInfo);
707  frombuf(buffer, &fNbytesInfo);
708  }
709  if (fBEGIN < 0 || fBEGIN > fEND) {
710  // humm fBEGIN is wrong ....
711  Error("Init","file %s has an incorrect header length (%lld) or incorrect end of file length (%lld)",
712  GetName(),fBEGIN,fEND);
713  goto zombie;
714  }
715  fSeekDir = fBEGIN;
716  //*-*-------------Read Free segments structure if file is writable
717  if (fWritable) {
718  fFree = new TList;
719  if (fSeekFree > fBEGIN) {
720  ReadFree();
721  } else {
722  Warning("Init","file %s probably not closed, cannot read free segments",GetName());
723  }
724  }
725  //*-*-------------Read directory info
726  // buffer_keyloc is the start of the key record.
727  char *buffer_keyloc = 0;
728 
729  Int_t nbytes = fNbytesName + TDirectoryFile::Sizeof();
730  if ( (nbytes + fBEGIN) > fEND) {
731  // humm fBEGIN is wrong ....
732  Error("Init","file %s has an incorrect header length (%lld) or incorrect end of file length (%lld)",
733  GetName(),fBEGIN+nbytes,fEND);
734  goto zombie;
735  }
736  if (nbytes+fBEGIN > kBEGIN+200) {
737  delete [] header;
738  header = new char[nbytes];
739  buffer = header;
740  Seek(fBEGIN);
741  if (ReadBuffer(buffer,nbytes)) {
742  // ReadBuffer returns kTRUE in case of failure.
743  Error("Init","%s failed to read the file header information at %lld (size=%d)",
744  GetName(),fBEGIN,nbytes);
745  delete [] header;
746  goto zombie;
747  }
748  buffer = header+fNbytesName;
749  buffer_keyloc = header;
750  } else {
751  buffer = header+fBEGIN+fNbytesName;
752  buffer_keyloc = header+fBEGIN;
753  }
754  Version_t version,versiondir;
755  frombuf(buffer,&version); versiondir = version%1000;
756  fDatimeC.ReadBuffer(buffer);
757  fDatimeM.ReadBuffer(buffer);
758  frombuf(buffer, &fNbytesKeys);
759  frombuf(buffer, &fNbytesName);
760  if (version > 1000) {
761  frombuf(buffer, &fSeekDir);
762  frombuf(buffer, &fSeekParent);
763  frombuf(buffer, &fSeekKeys);
764  } else {
765  Int_t sdir,sparent,skeys;
766  frombuf(buffer, &sdir); fSeekDir = (Long64_t)sdir;
767  frombuf(buffer, &sparent); fSeekParent = (Long64_t)sparent;
768  frombuf(buffer, &skeys); fSeekKeys = (Long64_t)skeys;
769  }
770  if (versiondir > 1) fUUID.ReadBuffer(buffer);
771 
772  //*-*---------read TKey::FillBuffer info
773  buffer_keyloc += sizeof(Int_t); // Skip NBytes;
774  Version_t keyversion;
775  frombuf(buffer_keyloc, &keyversion);
776  // Skip ObjLen, DateTime, KeyLen, Cycle, SeekKey, SeekPdir
777  if (keyversion > 1000) {
778  // Large files
779  buffer_keyloc += 2*sizeof(Int_t)+2*sizeof(Short_t)+2*sizeof(Long64_t);
780  } else {
781  buffer_keyloc += 2*sizeof(Int_t)+2*sizeof(Short_t)+2*sizeof(Int_t);
782  }
783  TString cname;
784  cname.ReadBuffer(buffer_keyloc);
785  cname.ReadBuffer(buffer_keyloc); // fName.ReadBuffer(buffer); file may have been renamed
786  fTitle.ReadBuffer(buffer_keyloc);
787  delete [] header;
788  if (fNbytesName < 10 || fNbytesName > 10000) {
789  Error("Init","cannot read directory info of file %s", GetName());
790  goto zombie;
791  }
792 
793  //*-* -------------Check if file is truncated
794  Long64_t size;
795  if ((size = GetSize()) == -1) {
796  Error("Init", "cannot stat the file %s", GetName());
797  goto zombie;
798  }
799 
800  //*-* -------------Check if, in case of inconsistencies, we are requested to
801  //*-* -------------attempt recovering the file
802  Bool_t tryrecover = (gEnv->GetValue("TFile.Recover", 1) == 1) ? kTRUE : kFALSE;
803 
804  //*-* -------------Read keys of the top directory
805  if (fSeekKeys > fBEGIN && fEND <= size) {
806  //normal case. Recover only if file has no keys
807  TDirectoryFile::ReadKeys(kFALSE);
808  gDirectory = this;
809  if (!GetNkeys()) {
810  if (tryrecover) {
811  Recover();
812  } else {
813  Error("Init", "file %s has no keys", GetName());
814  goto zombie;
815  }
816  }
817  } else if ((fBEGIN+nbytes == fEND) && (fEND == size)) {
818  //the file might be open by another process and nothing written to the file yet
819  Warning("Init","file %s has no keys", GetName());
820  gDirectory = this;
821  } else {
822  //something had been written to the file. Trailer is missing, must recover
823  if (fEND > size) {
824  if (tryrecover) {
825  Error("Init","file %s is truncated at %lld bytes: should be %lld, "
826  "trying to recover", GetName(), size, fEND);
827  } else {
828  Error("Init","file %s is truncated at %lld bytes: should be %lld",
829  GetName(), size, fEND);
830  goto zombie;
831  }
832  } else {
833  if (tryrecover) {
834  Warning("Init","file %s probably not closed, "
835  "trying to recover", GetName());
836  } else {
837  Warning("Init","file %s probably not closed", GetName());
838  goto zombie;
839  }
840  }
841  Int_t nrecov = Recover();
842  if (nrecov) {
843  Warning("Init", "successfully recovered %d keys", nrecov);
844  } else {
845  Warning("Init", "no keys recovered, file has been made a Zombie");
846  goto zombie;
847  }
848  }
849  }
850 
851  {
852  R__LOCKGUARD(gROOTMutex);
853  gROOT->GetListOfFiles()->Add(this);
854  gROOT->GetUUIDs()->AddUUID(fUUID,this);
855  }
856 
857  // Create StreamerInfo index
858  {
859  Int_t lenIndex = gROOT->GetListOfStreamerInfo()->GetSize()+1;
860  if (lenIndex < 5000) lenIndex = 5000;
861  fClassIndex = new TArrayC(lenIndex);
862  if (fgReadInfo) {
863  if (fSeekInfo > fBEGIN) {
864  ReadStreamerInfo();
865  if (IsZombie()) {
866  R__LOCKGUARD(gROOTMutex);
867  gROOT->GetListOfFiles()->Remove(this);
868  goto zombie;
869  }
870  } else if (fVersion != gROOT->GetVersionInt() && fVersion > 30000) {
871  // Don't complain about missing streamer info for empty files.
872  if (fKeys->GetSize()) {
873  Warning("Init","no StreamerInfo found in %s therefore preventing schema evolution when reading this file.",GetName());
874  }
875  }
876  }
877  }
878 
879  // Count number of TProcessIDs in this file
880  {
881  TIter next(fKeys);
882  TKey *key;
883  while ((key = (TKey*)next())) {
884  if (!strcmp(key->GetClassName(),"TProcessID")) fNProcessIDs++;
885  }
886  fProcessIDs = new TObjArray(fNProcessIDs+1);
887  }
888  return;
889 
890 zombie:
891  {
892  R__LOCKGUARD(gROOTMutex);
893  gROOT->GetListOfClosedObjects()->Add(this);
894  }
895  // error in file opening occurred, make this object a zombie
896  fWritable = kFALSE;
897  MakeZombie();
898  gDirectory = gROOT;
899 }
900 
901 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
902 /// Close a file.
903 ///
904 /// \param[in] option If option == "R", all TProcessIDs referenced by this file are deleted.
905 ///
906 /// Calling TFile::Close("R") might be necessary in case one reads a long list
907 /// of files having TRef, writing some of the referenced objects or TRef
908 /// to a new file. If the TRef or referenced objects of the file being closed
909 /// will not be referenced again, it is possible to minimize the size
910 /// of the TProcessID data structures in memory by forcing a delete of
911 /// the unused TProcessID.
912 
913 void TFile::Close(Option_t *option)
914 {
915  TString opt = option;
916 
917  opt.ToLower();
918 
919  if (!IsOpen()) return;
920 
921  if (fIsArchive || !fIsRootFile) {
922  FlushWriteCache();
923  SysClose(fD);
924  fD = -1;
925 
926  if (gMonitoringWriter)
927  gMonitoringWriter->SendFileCloseEvent(this);
928 
929  return;
930  }
931 
932  if (IsWritable()) {
933  WriteStreamerInfo();
934  }
935 
936  // Finish any concurrent I/O operations before we close the file handles.
937  if (fCacheRead) fCacheRead->Close();
938  {
939  TIter iter(fCacheReadMap);
940  TObject *key = 0;
941  while ((key = iter()) != 0) {
942  TFileCacheRead *cache = dynamic_cast<TFileCacheRead *>(fCacheReadMap->GetValue(key));
943  cache->Close();
944  }
945  }
946 
947  // Delete all supported directories structures from memory
948  // If gDirectory points to this object or any of the nested
949  // TDirectoryFile, TDirectoryFile::Close will induce the proper cd.
950  fMustFlush = kFALSE; // Make sure there is only one Flush.
951  TDirectoryFile::Close(option);
952 
953  if (IsWritable()) {
954  TFree *f1 = (TFree*)fFree->First();
955  if (f1) {
956  WriteFree(); //*-*- Write free segments linked list
957  WriteHeader(); //*-*- Now write file header ; this forces a Flush/fsync
958  } else {
959  Flush();
960  }
961  }
962  fMustFlush = kTRUE;
963 
964  FlushWriteCache();
965 
966  if (gMonitoringWriter)
967  gMonitoringWriter->SendFileCloseEvent(this);
968 
969  delete fClassIndex;
970  fClassIndex = 0;
971 
972  // Delete free segments from free list (but don't delete list header)
973  if (fFree) {
974  fFree->Delete();
975  }
976 
977  if (IsOpen()) {
978  SysClose(fD);
979  fD = -1;
980  }
981 
982  fWritable = kFALSE;
983 
984  // delete the TProcessIDs
985  TList pidDeleted;
986  TIter next(fProcessIDs);
987  TProcessID *pid;
988  while ((pid = (TProcessID*)next())) {
989  if (!pid->DecrementCount()) {
990  if (pid != TProcessID::GetSessionProcessID()) pidDeleted.Add(pid);
991  } else if(opt.Contains("r")) {
992  pid->Clear();
993  }
994  }
995  pidDeleted.Delete();
996 
997  if (!IsZombie()) {
998  R__LOCKGUARD(gROOTMutex);
999  gROOT->GetListOfFiles()->Remove(this);
1000  gROOT->GetListOfBrowsers()->RecursiveRemove(this);
1001  gROOT->GetListOfClosedObjects()->Add(this);
1002  } else {
1003  // If we are a zombie, we are already in the list of closed objects.
1004  }
1005 }

1023 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1024 /// Return the current ROOT file if any.
1025 ///
1026 /// Note that if 'cd' has been called on a TDirectory that does not belong to a file,
1027 /// gFile will be unchanged and still points to the file of the previous current
1028 /// directory that was a file.
1029 
1030 TFile *&TFile::CurrentFile()
1031 {
1032  static TFile *currentFile = 0;
1033  if (!gThreadTsd)
1034  return currentFile;
1035  else
1036  return *(TFile**)(*gThreadTsd)(&currentFile,ROOT::kFileThreadSlot);
1037 }

1039 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1040 /// Delete object namecycle.
1041 ///
1042 /// \param[in] namecycle Encodes the name and cycle of the objects to delete
1043 ///
1044 /// Namecycle identifies an object in the top directory of the file namecycle
1045 /// has the format <em>name;cycle</em>.
1046 /// - <em>name = *</em> means all objects
1047 /// - <em>cycle = *</em> means all cycles (memory and keys)
1048 /// - <em>cycle = ""</em> or cycle = 9999 ==> apply to a memory object
1049 /// When name=* use T* to delete subdirectories also
1050 ///
1051 /// Examples:
1052 /// name/cycle | Action
1053 /// -----------|-------
1054 /// foo | delete object named foo in memory
1055 /// foo;1 | delete cycle 1 of foo on file
1056 /// foo;* | delete all cycles of foo on disk and also from memory
1057 /// *;2 | delete all objects on file having the cycle 2
1058 /// *;* | delete all objects from memory and file
1059 /// T*;* | delete all objects from memory and file and all subdirectories
1060 
1061 void TFile::Delete(const char *namecycle)
1062 {
1063  if (gDebug)
1064  Info("Delete", "deleting name = %s", namecycle);
1065 
1066  TDirectoryFile::Delete(namecycle);
1067 }

1092 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1093 /// Synchronize a file's in-memory and on-disk states.
1094 
1095 void TFile::Flush()
1096 {
1097  if (IsOpen() && fWritable) {
1098  FlushWriteCache();
1099  if (SysSync(fD) < 0) {
1100  // Write the system error only once for this file
1101  SetBit(kWriteError); SetWritable(kFALSE);
1102  SysError("Flush", "error flushing file %s", GetName());
1103  }
1104  }
1105 }

1107 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1108 /// Flush the write cache if active.
1109 ///
1110 /// Return kTRUE in case of error
1111 
1112 Bool_t TFile::FlushWriteCache()
1113 {
1114  if (fCacheWrite && IsOpen() && fWritable)
1115  return fCacheWrite->Flush();
1116  return kFALSE;
1117 }

1122 /// The file output buffer contains only the FREE data record.

1125 {

1130 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1131 /// Return the best buffer size of objects on this file.
1132 ///
1133 /// The best buffer size is estimated based on the current mean value
1134 /// and standard deviation of all objects written so far to this file.
1135 /// Returns mean value + one standard deviation.
1136 
1137 Int_t TFile::GetBestBuffer() const
1138 {
1139  if (!fWritten) return TBuffer::kInitialSize;
1140  Double_t mean = fSumBuffer/fWritten;
1141  Double_t rms2 = TMath::Abs(fSum2Buffer/fSumBuffer -mean*mean);
1142  return (Int_t)(mean + sqrt(rms2));
1143 }
1144 
1145 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1146 /// Return the file compression factor.
1147 ///
1148 /// Add total number of compressed/uncompressed bytes for each key.
1149 /// Returns the ratio of the two.
1150 
1151 Float_t TFile::GetCompressionFactor()
1152 {
1153  Short_t keylen;
1154  UInt_t datime;
1155  Int_t nbytes, objlen, nwh = 64;
1156  char *header = new char[fBEGIN];
1157  char *buffer;
1158  Long64_t idcur = fBEGIN;
1159  Float_t comp,uncomp;
1160  comp = uncomp = fBEGIN;
1161 
1162  while (idcur < fEND-100) {
1163  Seek(idcur);
1164  if (ReadBuffer(header, nwh)) {
1165  // ReadBuffer returns kTRUE in case of failure.
1166 // Error("GetCompressionFactor","%s failed to read the key header information at %lld (size=%d).",
1167 // GetName(),idcur,nwh);
1168  break;
1169  }
1170  buffer=header;
1171  frombuf(buffer, &nbytes);
1172  if (nbytes < 0) {
1173  idcur -= nbytes;
1174  Seek(idcur);
1175  continue;
1176  }
1177  if (nbytes == 0) break; //this may happen when the file is corrupted
1178  Version_t versionkey;
1179  frombuf(buffer, &versionkey);
1180  frombuf(buffer, &objlen);
1181  frombuf(buffer, &datime);
1182  frombuf(buffer, &keylen);
1183  if (!objlen) objlen = nbytes-keylen;
1184  comp += nbytes;
1185  uncomp += keylen + objlen;
1186  idcur += nbytes;
1187  }
1188  delete [] header;
1189  return uncomp/comp;
1190 }

1208 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

1211 TFileCacheRead *TFile::GetCacheRead(const TObject* tree) const
1212 {
1213  if (!tree) {
1214  if (!fCacheRead && fCacheReadMap->GetSize() == 1) {
1215  TIter next(fCacheReadMap);
1216  return (TFileCacheRead *)fCacheReadMap->GetValue(next());
1217  }
1218  return fCacheRead;
1219  }
1220  TFileCacheRead *cache = (TFileCacheRead *)fCacheReadMap->GetValue(tree);
1221  if (!cache) return fCacheRead;
1222  return cache;
1223 }

1233 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1234 /// Read the logical record header starting at a certain postion.
1235 ///
1236 /// \param[in] maxbytes Bytes which are read into buf.
1237 /// \param[out] nbytes Number of bytes in record if negative, this is a deleted
1238 /// record if 0, cannot read record, wrong value of argument first
1239 /// \param[out] objlen Uncompressed object size
1240 /// \param[out] keylen Length of logical record header
1241 ///
1242 /// The function reads nread bytes
1243 /// where nread is the minimum of maxbytes and the number of bytes
1244 /// before the end of file. The function returns nread.
1245 /// Note that the arguments objlen and keylen are returned only
1246 /// if maxbytes >=16
1247 
1248 Int_t TFile::GetRecordHeader(char *buf, Long64_t first, Int_t maxbytes, Int_t &nbytes, Int_t &objlen, Int_t &keylen)
1249 {
1250  nbytes = 0;
1251  objlen = 0;
1252  keylen = 0;
1253  if (first < fBEGIN) return 0;
1254  if (first > fEND) return 0;
1255  Seek(first);
1256  Int_t nread = maxbytes;
1257  if (first+maxbytes > fEND) nread = fEND-maxbytes;
1258  if (nread < 4) {
1259  Warning("GetRecordHeader","%s: parameter maxbytes = %d must be >= 4",
1260  GetName(), nread);
1261  return nread;
1262  }
1263  if (ReadBuffer(buf,nread)) {
1264  // ReadBuffer return kTRUE in case of failure.
1265  Warning("GetRecordHeader","%s: failed to read header data (maxbytes = %d)",
1266  GetName(), nread);
1267  return nread;
1268  }
1269  Version_t versionkey;
1270  Short_t klen;
1271  UInt_t datime;
1272  Int_t nb,olen;
1273  char *buffer = buf;
1274  frombuf(buffer,&nb);
1275  nbytes = nb;
1276  if (nb < 0) return nread;
1277  // const Int_t headerSize = Int_t(sizeof(nb) +sizeof(versionkey) +sizeof(olen) +sizeof(datime) +sizeof(klen));
1278  const Int_t headerSize = 16;
1279  if (nread < headerSize) return nread;
1280  frombuf(buffer, &versionkey);
1281  frombuf(buffer, &olen);
1282  frombuf(buffer, &datime);
1283  frombuf(buffer, &klen);
1284  if (!olen) olen = nbytes-klen;
1285  objlen = olen;
1286  keylen = klen;
1287  return nread;
1288 }
1289 
1290 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1291 /// Returns the current file size. Returns -1 in case the file could not
1292 /// be stat'ed.
1293 
1294 Long64_t TFile::GetSize() const
1295 {
1296  Long64_t size;
1297 
1298  if (fArchive && fArchive->GetMember()) {
1299  size = fArchive->GetMember()->GetDecompressedSize();
1300  } else {
1301  Long_t id, flags, modtime;
1302  if (const_cast<TFile*>(this)->SysStat(fD, &id, &size, &flags, &modtime)) {
1303  Error("GetSize", "cannot stat the file %s", GetName());
1304  return -1;
1305  }
1306  }
1307  return size;
1308 }

1317 
1318 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1319 /// See documentation of GetStreamerInfoList for more details.
1320 /// This is an internal method which returns the list of streamer infos and also
1321 /// information about the success of the operation.
1322 
1323 TFile::InfoListRet TFile::GetStreamerInfoListImpl(bool lookupSICache)
1324 {
1325  ROOT::Internal::RConcurrentHashColl::HashValue hash;
1326 
1327  if (fIsPcmFile) return {nullptr, 1, hash}; // No schema evolution for ROOT PCM files.
1328 
1329  TList *list = 0;
1330  if (fSeekInfo) {
1331  TDirectory::TContext ctxt(this); // gFile and gDirectory used in ReadObj
1332  auto key = std::make_unique<TKey>(this);
1333  std::vector<char> buffer(fNbytesInfo+1);
1334  auto buf = buffer.data();
1335  Seek(fSeekInfo);
1336  if (ReadBuffer(buf,fNbytesInfo)) {
1337  // ReadBuffer returns kTRUE in case of failure.
1338  Warning("GetRecordHeader","%s: failed to read the StreamerInfo data from disk.",
1339  GetName());
1340  return {nullptr, 1, hash};
1341  }
1342 
1343 #ifdef R__USE_IMT
1344  if (lookupSICache) {
1345  hash = fgTsSIHashes.Hash(buf, fNbytesInfo);
1346  if (fgTsSIHashes.Find(hash)) {
1347  if (gDebug > 0) Info("GetStreamerInfo", "The streamer info record for file %s has already been treated, skipping it.", GetName());
1348  return {nullptr, 0, hash};
1349  }
1350  }
1351 #else
1352  (void) lookupSICache;
1353 #endif
1354  key->ReadKeyBuffer(buf);
1355  list = dynamic_cast<TList*>(key->ReadObjWithBuffer(buffer.data()));
1356  if (list) list->SetOwner();
1357  } else {
1358  list = (TList*)Get("StreamerInfo"); //for versions 2.26 (never released)
1359  }
1360 
1361  if (list == 0) {
1362  Info("GetStreamerInfoList", "cannot find the StreamerInfo record in file %s",
1363  GetName());
1364  return {nullptr, 1, hash};
1365  }
1366 
1367  return {list, 0, hash};
1368 }

1370 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1371 /// Read the list of TStreamerInfo objects written to this file.
1372 ///
1373 /// The function returns a TList. It is the user's responsibility
1374 /// to delete the list created by this function.
1375 ///
1376 /// Note the list, in addition to TStreamerInfo object, contains sometimes
1377 /// a TList named 'listOfRules' and containing the schema evolution rules
1378 /// related to the file's content.

1380 /// Using the list, one can access additional information, e.g.:

1384 /// auto info = dynamic_cast<TStreamerInfo*>(list->FindObject("MyClass"));
1385 /// if (info) auto classversionid = info->GetClassVersion();
1386 /// delete list;
1387 /// ~~~
1388 ///

1400 /// then objects on the file.
1401 
1402 void TFile::ls(Option_t *option) const
1403 {

1405  std::cout <<ClassName()<<"**\t\t"<<GetName()<<"\t"<<GetTitle()<<std::endl;

1411 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1412 /// Returns kTRUE in case file is open and kFALSE if file is not open.
1413 
1414 Bool_t TFile::IsOpen() const
1415 {
1416  return fD == -1 ? kFALSE : kTRUE;
1417 }
1418 
1419 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1420 /// Mark unused bytes on the file.
1421 ///
1422 /// The list of free segments is in the fFree linked list.
1423 /// When an object is deleted from the file, the freed space is added
1424 /// into the FREE linked list (fFree). The FREE list consists of a chain
1425 /// of consecutive free segments on the file. At the same time, the first
1426 /// 4 bytes of the freed record on the file are overwritten by GAPSIZE
1427 /// where GAPSIZE = -(Number of bytes occupied by the record).
1428 
1429 void TFile::MakeFree(Long64_t first, Long64_t last)
1430 {
1431  TFree *f1 = (TFree*)fFree->First();
1432  if (!f1) return;
1433  TFree *newfree = f1->AddFree(fFree,first,last);
1434  if(!newfree) return;
1435  Long64_t nfirst = newfree->GetFirst();
1436  Long64_t nlast = newfree->GetLast();
1437  Long64_t nbytesl= nlast-nfirst+1;
1438  if (nbytesl > 2000000000) nbytesl = 2000000000;
1439  Int_t nbytes = -Int_t (nbytesl);
1440  Int_t nb = sizeof(Int_t);
1441  char * buffer = new char[nb];
1442  char * psave = buffer;
1443  tobuf(buffer, nbytes);
1444  if (last == fEND-1) fEND = nfirst;
1445  Seek(nfirst);
1446  // We could not update the meta data for this block on the file.
1447  // This is not fatal as this only means that we won't get it 'right'
1448  // if we ever need to Recover the file before the block is actually
1449  // (attempted to be reused.
1450  // coverity[unchecked_value]
1451  WriteBuffer(psave, nb);
1452  if (fMustFlush) Flush();
1453  delete [] psave;
1454 }
1455 
1456 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1457 /// List the contents of a file sequentially.
1458 /// For each logical record found, it prints:
1459 ///
1460 /// Date/Time Record_Adress Logical_Record_Length ClassName CompressionFactor
1461 ///
1462 /// Example of output
1463 ///
1464 /// 20010404/150437 At:64 N=150 TFile
1465 /// 20010404/150440 At:214 N=28326 TBasket CX = 1.13
1466 /// 20010404/150440 At:28540 N=29616 TBasket CX = 1.08
1467 /// 20010404/150440 At:58156 N=29640 TBasket CX = 1.08
1468 /// 20010404/150440 At:87796 N=29076 TBasket CX = 1.10
1469 /// 20010404/150440 At:116872 N=10151 TBasket CX = 3.15
1470 /// 20010404/150441 At:127023 N=28341 TBasket CX = 1.13
1471 /// 20010404/150441 At:155364 N=29594 TBasket CX = 1.08
1472 /// 20010404/150441 At:184958 N=29616 TBasket CX = 1.08
1473 /// 20010404/150441 At:214574 N=29075 TBasket CX = 1.10
1474 /// 20010404/150441 At:243649 N=9583 TBasket CX = 3.34
1475 /// 20010404/150442 At:253232 N=28324 TBasket CX = 1.13
1476 /// 20010404/150442 At:281556 N=29641 TBasket CX = 1.08
1477 /// 20010404/150442 At:311197 N=29633 TBasket CX = 1.08
1478 /// 20010404/150442 At:340830 N=29091 TBasket CX = 1.10
1479 /// 20010404/150442 At:369921 N=10341 TBasket CX = 3.09
1480 /// 20010404/150442 At:380262 N=509 TH1F CX = 1.93
1481 /// 20010404/150442 At:380771 N=1769 TH2F CX = 4.32
1482 /// 20010404/150442 At:382540 N=1849 TProfile CX = 1.65
1483 /// 20010404/150442 At:384389 N=18434 TNtuple CX = 4.51
1484 /// 20010404/150442 At:402823 N=307 KeysList
1485 /// 20010404/150443 At:403130 N=4548 StreamerInfo CX = 3.65
1486 /// 20010404/150443 At:407678 N=86 FreeSegments
1487 /// 20010404/150443 At:407764 N=1 END
1488 ///
1489 /// If the parameter opt contains "forComp", the Date/Time is ommitted
1490 /// and the decompressed size is also printed.
1491 ///
1492 /// Record_Adress Logical_Record_Length Key_Length Object_Record_Length ClassName CompressionFactor
1493 ///
1494 /// Example of output
1495 ///
1496 
1497 
1498 void TFile::Map(Option_t *opt)
1499 {
1500  TString options(opt);
1501  options.ToLower();
1502  bool forComp = options.Contains("forcomp");
1503 
1504  Short_t keylen,cycle;
1505  UInt_t datime;
1506  Int_t nbytes,date,time,objlen,nwheader;
1507  date = 0;
1508  time = 0;
1509  Long64_t seekkey,seekpdir;
1510  char *buffer;
1511  char nwhc;
1512  Long64_t idcur = fBEGIN;
1513 
1514  nwheader = 64;
1515  Int_t nread = nwheader;
1516 
1517  char header[kBEGIN];
1518  char classname[512];
1519 
1520  unsigned char nDigits = std::log10(fEND) + 1;
1521 
1522  while (idcur < fEND) {
1523  Seek(idcur);
1524  if (idcur+nread >= fEND) nread = fEND-idcur-1;
1525  if (ReadBuffer(header, nread)) {
1526  // ReadBuffer returns kTRUE in case of failure.
1527  Warning("Map","%s: failed to read the key data from disk at %lld.",
1528  GetName(),idcur);
1529  break;
1530  }
1531 
1532  buffer=header;
1533  frombuf(buffer, &nbytes);
1534  if (!nbytes) {
1535  Printf("Address = %lld\tNbytes = %d\t=====E R R O R=======", idcur, nbytes);
1536  date = 0; time = 0;
1537  break;
1538  }
1539  if (nbytes < 0) {
1540  Printf("Address = %lld\tNbytes = %d\t=====G A P===========", idcur, nbytes);
1541  idcur -= nbytes;
1542  Seek(idcur);
1543  continue;
1544  }
1545  Version_t versionkey;
1546  frombuf(buffer, &versionkey);
1547  frombuf(buffer, &objlen);
1548  frombuf(buffer, &datime);
1549  frombuf(buffer, &keylen);
1550  frombuf(buffer, &cycle);
1551  if (versionkey > 1000) {
1552  frombuf(buffer, &seekkey);
1553  frombuf(buffer, &seekpdir);
1554  } else {
1555  Int_t skey,sdir;
1556  frombuf(buffer, &skey); seekkey = (Long64_t)skey;
1557  frombuf(buffer, &sdir); seekpdir = (Long64_t)sdir;
1558  }
1559  frombuf(buffer, &nwhc);
1560  for (int i = 0;i < nwhc; i++) frombuf(buffer, &classname[i]);
1561  classname[(int)nwhc] = '\0'; //cast to avoid warning with gcc3.4
1562  if (idcur == fSeekFree) strlcpy(classname,"FreeSegments",512);
1563  if (idcur == fSeekInfo) strlcpy(classname,"StreamerInfo",512);
1564  if (idcur == fSeekKeys) strlcpy(classname,"KeysList",512);
1565  TDatime::GetDateTime(datime, date, time);
1566  if (!forComp) {
1567  if (objlen != nbytes - keylen) {
1568  Float_t cx = Float_t(objlen + keylen) / Float_t(nbytes);
1569  Printf("%d/%06d At:%-*lld N=%-8d %-14s CX = %5.2f", date, time, nDigits + 1, idcur, nbytes, classname,
1570  cx);
1571  } else {
1572  Printf("%d/%06d At:%-*lld N=%-8d %-14s", date, time, nDigits + 1, idcur, nbytes, classname);
1573  }
1574  } else {
1575  // Printing to help compare two files.
1576  if (objlen != nbytes - keylen) {
1577  Float_t cx = Float_t(objlen + keylen) / Float_t(nbytes);
1578  Printf("At:%-*lld N=%-8d K=%-3d O=%-8d %-14s CX = %5.2f", nDigits+1, idcur, nbytes, keylen, objlen, classname, cx);
1579  } else {
1580  Printf("At:%-*lld N=%-8d K=%-3d O=%-8d %-14s CX = 1", nDigits+1, idcur, nbytes, keylen, objlen, classname);
1581  }
1582  }
1583  idcur += nbytes;
1584  }
1585  if (!forComp)
1586  Printf("%d/%06d At:%-*lld N=%-8d %-14s",date,time, nDigits+1, idcur,1,"END");
1587  else
1588  Printf("At:%-*lld N=%-8d K= O= %-14s", nDigits+1, idcur,1,"END");
1589 }

1607 
1608 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1609 /// Read a buffer from the file at the offset 'pos' in the file.
1610 ///
1611 /// Returns kTRUE in case of failure.
1612 /// Compared to ReadBuffer(char*, Int_t), this routine does _not_
1613 /// change the cursor on the physical file representation (fD)
1614 /// if the data is in this TFile's cache.
1615 
1616 Bool_t TFile::ReadBuffer(char *buf, Long64_t pos, Int_t len)
1617 {
1618  if (IsOpen()) {
1619 
1620  SetOffset(pos);
1621 
1622  Int_t st;
1623  Double_t start = 0;
1624  if (gPerfStats != 0) start = TTimeStamp();
1625 
1626  if ((st = ReadBufferViaCache(buf, len))) {
1627  if (st == 2)
1628  return kTRUE;
1629  return kFALSE;
1630  }
1631 
1632  Seek(pos);
1633  ssize_t siz;
1634 
1635  while ((siz = SysRead(fD, buf, len)) < 0 && GetErrno() == EINTR)
1636  ResetErrno();
1637 
1638  if (siz < 0) {
1639  SysError("ReadBuffer", "error reading from file %s", GetName());
1640  return kTRUE;
1641  }
1642  if (siz != len) {
1643  Error("ReadBuffer", "error reading all requested bytes from file %s, got %ld of %d",
1644  GetName(), (Long_t)siz, len);
1645  return kTRUE;
1646  }
1647  fBytesRead += siz;
1648  fgBytesRead += siz;
1649  fReadCalls++;
1650  fgReadCalls++;
1651 
1652  if (gMonitoringWriter)
1653  gMonitoringWriter->SendFileReadProgress(this);
1654  if (gPerfStats != 0) {
1655  gPerfStats->FileReadEvent(this, len, start);
1656  }
1657  return kFALSE;
1658  }
1659  return kTRUE;
1660 }
1661 
1662 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1663 /// Read a buffer from the file. This is the basic low level read operation.
1664 /// Returns kTRUE in case of failure.
1665 
1666 Bool_t TFile::ReadBuffer(char *buf, Int_t len)
1667 {
1668  if (IsOpen()) {
1669 
1670  Int_t st;
1671  if ((st = ReadBufferViaCache(buf, len))) {
1672  if (st == 2)
1673  return kTRUE;
1674  return kFALSE;
1675  }
1676 
1677  ssize_t siz;
1678  Double_t start = 0;
1679 
1680  if (gPerfStats != 0) start = TTimeStamp();
1681 
1682  while ((siz = SysRead(fD, buf, len)) < 0 && GetErrno() == EINTR)
1683  ResetErrno();
1684 
1685  if (siz < 0) {
1686  SysError("ReadBuffer", "error reading from file %s", GetName());
1687  return kTRUE;
1688  }
1689  if (siz != len) {
1690  Error("ReadBuffer", "error reading all requested bytes from file %s, got %ld of %d",
1691  GetName(), (Long_t)siz, len);
1692  return kTRUE;
1693  }
1694  fBytesRead += siz;
1695  fgBytesRead += siz;
1696  fReadCalls++;
1697  fgReadCalls++;
1698 
1699  if (gMonitoringWriter)
1700  gMonitoringWriter->SendFileReadProgress(this);
1701  if (gPerfStats != 0) {
1702  gPerfStats->FileReadEvent(this, len, start);
1703  }
1704  return kFALSE;
1705  }
1706  return kTRUE;
1707 }
1708 
1709 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1710 /// Read the nbuf blocks described in arrays pos and len.
1711 ///
1712 /// The value pos[i] is the seek position of block i of length len[i].
1713 /// Note that for nbuf=1, this call is equivalent to TFile::ReafBuffer.
1714 /// This function is overloaded by TNetFile, TWebFile, etc.
1715 /// Returns kTRUE in case of failure.
1716 
1717 Bool_t TFile::ReadBuffers(char *buf, Long64_t *pos, Int_t *len, Int_t nbuf)
1718 {
1719  // called with buf=0, from TFileCacheRead to pass list of readahead buffers
1720  if (!buf) {
1721  for (Int_t j = 0; j < nbuf; j++) {
1722  if (ReadBufferAsync(pos[j], len[j])) {
1723  return kTRUE;
1724  }
1725  }
1726  return kFALSE;
1727  }
1728 
1729  Int_t k = 0;
1730  Bool_t result = kTRUE;
1731  TFileCacheRead *old = fCacheRead;
1732  fCacheRead = 0;
1733  Long64_t curbegin = pos[0];
1734  Long64_t cur;
1735  char *buf2 = 0;
1736  Int_t i = 0, n = 0;
1737  while (i < nbuf) {
1738  cur = pos[i]+len[i];
1739  Bool_t bigRead = kTRUE;
1740  if (cur -curbegin < fgReadaheadSize) {n++; i++; bigRead = kFALSE;}
1741  if (bigRead || (i>=nbuf)) {
1742  if (n == 0) {
1743  //if the block to read is about the same size as the read-ahead buffer
1744  //we read the block directly
1745  Seek(pos[i]);
1746  result = ReadBuffer(&buf[k], len[i]);
1747  if (result) break;
1748  k += len[i];
1749  i++;
1750  } else {
1751  //otherwise we read all blocks that fit in the read-ahead buffer
1752  Seek(curbegin);
1753  if (buf2 == 0) buf2 = new char[fgReadaheadSize];
1754  //we read ahead
1755  Long64_t nahead = pos[i-1]+len[i-1]-curbegin;
1756  result = ReadBuffer(buf2, nahead);
1757  if (result) break;
1758  //now copy from the read-ahead buffer to the cache
1759  Int_t kold = k;
1760  for (Int_t j=0;j<n;j++) {
1761  memcpy(&buf[k],&buf2[pos[i-n+j]-curbegin],len[i-n+j]);
1762  k += len[i-n+j];
1763  }
1764  Int_t nok = k-kold;
1765  Long64_t extra = nahead-nok;
1766  fBytesReadExtra += extra;
1767  fBytesRead -= extra;
1768  fgBytesRead -= extra;
1769  n = 0;
1770  }
1771  curbegin = i < nbuf ? pos[i] : 0;
1772  }
1773  }
1774  if (buf2) delete [] buf2;
1775  fCacheRead = old;
1776  return result;
1777 }
1778 
1779 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1780 /// Read buffer via cache.
1781 ///
1782 /// Returns 0 if the requested block is not in the cache, 1 in case read via
1783 /// cache was successful, 2 in case read via cache failed.
1784 
1785 Int_t TFile::ReadBufferViaCache(char *buf, Int_t len)
1786 {
1787  Long64_t off = GetRelOffset();
1788  if (fCacheRead) {
1789  Int_t st = fCacheRead->ReadBuffer(buf, off, len);
1790  if (st < 0)
1791  return 2; // failure reading
1792  else if (st == 1) {
1793  // fOffset might have been changed via TFileCacheRead::ReadBuffer(), reset it
1794  SetOffset(off + len);
1795  return 1;
1796  }
1797  // fOffset might have been changed via TFileCacheRead::ReadBuffer(), reset it
1798  Seek(off);
1799  } else {
1800  // if write cache is active check if data still in write cache
1801  if (fWritable && fCacheWrite) {
1802  if (fCacheWrite->ReadBuffer(buf, off, len) == 0) {
1803  SetOffset(off + len);
1804  return 1;
1805  }
1806  // fOffset might have been changed via TFileCacheWrite::ReadBuffer(), reset it
1807  SetOffset(off);
1808  }
1809  }
1810 
1811  return 0;
1812 }
1813 
1814 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1815 /// Read the FREE linked list.
1816 ///
1817 /// Every file has a linked list (fFree) of free segments.
1818 /// This linked list has been written on the file via WriteFree
1819 /// as a single data record.
1820 
1821 void TFile::ReadFree()
1822 {
1823  // Avoid problem with file corruption.
1824  if (fNbytesFree < 0 || fNbytesFree > fEND) {
1825  fNbytesFree = 0;
1826  return;
1827  }
1828  TKey *headerfree = new TKey(fSeekFree, fNbytesFree, this);
1829  headerfree->ReadFile();
1830  char *buffer = headerfree->GetBuffer();
1831  headerfree->ReadKeyBuffer(buffer);
1832  buffer = headerfree->GetBuffer();
1833  while (1) {
1834  TFree *afree = new TFree();
1835  afree->ReadBuffer(buffer);
1836  fFree->Add(afree);
1837  if (afree->GetLast() > fEND) break;
1838  }
1839  delete headerfree;
1840 }
1841 
1842 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1843 /// The TProcessID with number pidf is read from this file.
1844 ///
1845 /// If the object is not already entered in the gROOT list, it is added.
1846 
1847 TProcessID *TFile::ReadProcessID(UShort_t pidf)
1848 {
1849  TProcessID *pid = 0;
1850  TObjArray *pids = GetListOfProcessIDs();
1851  if (pidf < pids->GetSize()) pid = (TProcessID *)pids->UncheckedAt(pidf);
1852  if (pid) {
1853  pid->CheckInit();
1854  return pid;
1855  }
1856 
1857  //check if fProcessIDs[uid] is set in file
1858  //if not set, read the process uid from file
1859  char pidname[32];
1860  snprintf(pidname,32,"ProcessID%d",pidf);
1861  pid = (TProcessID *)Get(pidname);
1862  if (gDebug > 0) {
1863  printf("ReadProcessID, name=%s, file=%s, pid=%lx\n",pidname,GetName(),(Long_t)pid);
1864  }
1865  if (!pid) {
1866  //file->Error("ReadProcessID","Cannot find %s in file %s",pidname,file->GetName());
1867  return pid;
1868  }
1869 
1870  //check that a similar pid is not already registered in fgPIDs
1871  TObjArray *pidslist = TProcessID::GetPIDs();
1872  TIter next(pidslist);
1873  TProcessID *p;
1874  bool found = false;
1875  R__RWLOCK_ACQUIRE_READ(fgRwLock);
1876  while ((p = (TProcessID*)next())) {
1877  if (!strcmp(p->GetTitle(),pid->GetTitle())) {
1878  found = true;
1879  break;
1880  }
1881  }
1882  R__RWLOCK_RELEASE_READ(fgRwLock);
1883 
1884  if (found) {
1885  delete pid;
1886  pids->AddAtAndExpand(p,pidf);
1887  p->IncrementCount();
1888  return p;
1889  }
1890 
1891  pids->AddAtAndExpand(pid,pidf);
1892  pid->IncrementCount();
1893 
1894  R__RWLOCK_ACQUIRE_WRITE(fgRwLock);
1895  pidslist->Add(pid);
1896  Int_t ind = pidslist->IndexOf(pid);
1897  pid->SetUniqueID((UInt_t)ind);
1898  R__RWLOCK_RELEASE_WRITE(fgRwLock);
1899 
1900  return pid;
1901 }
1902 
1903 
1904 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1905 /// Attempt to recover file if not correctly closed
1906 ///
1907 /// The function returns the number of keys that have been recovered.
1908 /// If no keys can be recovered, the file will be declared Zombie by
1909 /// the calling function. This function is automatically called when
1910 /// opening a file.
1911 /// If the file is open in read only mode, the file is not modified.
1912 /// If open in update mode and the function finds something to recover,
1913 /// a new directory header is written to the file. When opening the file gain
1914 /// no message from Recover will be reported.
1915 /// If keys have been recovered, the file is usable and you can safely
1916 /// read the corresponding objects.
1917 /// If the file is not usable (a zombie), you can test for this case
1918 /// with code like:
1919 ///
1920 /// ~~~{.cpp}
1921 /// TFile f("myfile.root");
1922 /// if (f.IsZombie()) {<actions to take if file is unusable>}
1923 /// ~~~
1924 ///
1925 /// If the file has been recovered, the bit kRecovered is set in the TFile object in memory.
1926 /// You can test if the file has been recovered with
1927 ///
1928 /// if (f.TestBit(TFile::kRecovered)) {... the file has been recovered}
1929 ///
1930 /// When writing TTrees to a file, it is important to save the Tree header
1931 /// at regular intervals (see TTree::AutoSave). If a file containing a Tree
1932 /// is recovered, the last Tree header written to the file will be used.
1933 /// In this case all the entries in all the branches written before writing
1934 /// the header are valid entries.
1935 /// One can disable the automatic recovery procedure by setting
1936 ///
1937 /// TFile.Recover 0
1938 ///
1939 /// in the <em>system.rootrc</em> file.
1940 
1941 Int_t TFile::Recover()
1942 {
1943  Short_t keylen,cycle;
1944  UInt_t datime;
1945  Int_t nbytes,date,time,objlen,nwheader;
1946  Long64_t seekkey,seekpdir;
1947  char header[1024];
1948  char *buffer, *bufread;
1949  char nwhc;
1950  Long64_t idcur = fBEGIN;
1951 
1952  Long64_t size;
1953  if ((size = GetSize()) == -1) {
1954  Error("Recover", "cannot stat the file %s", GetName());
1955  return 0;
1956  }
1957 
1958  fEND = Long64_t(size);
1959 
1960  if (fWritable && !fFree) fFree = new TList;
1961 
1962  TKey *key;
1963  Int_t nrecov = 0;
1964  nwheader = 1024;
1965  Int_t nread = nwheader;
1966 
1967  while (idcur < fEND) {
1968  Seek(idcur);
1969  if (idcur+nread >= fEND) nread = fEND-idcur-1;
1970  if (ReadBuffer(header, nread)) {
1971  // ReadBuffer returns kTRUE in case of failure.
1972  Error("Recover","%s: failed to read the key data from disk at %lld.",
1973  GetName(),idcur);
1974  break;
1975  }
1976  buffer = header;
1977  bufread = header;
1978  frombuf(buffer, &nbytes);
1979  if (!nbytes) {
1980  Error("Recover","Address = %lld\tNbytes = %d\t=====E R R O R=======", idcur, nbytes);
1981  break;
1982  }
1983  if (nbytes < 0) {
1984  idcur -= nbytes;
1985  if (fWritable) new TFree(fFree,idcur,idcur-nbytes-1);
1986  Seek(idcur);
1987  continue;
1988  }
1989  Version_t versionkey;
1990  frombuf(buffer, &versionkey);
1991  frombuf(buffer, &objlen);
1992  frombuf(buffer, &datime);
1993  frombuf(buffer, &keylen);
1994  frombuf(buffer, &cycle);
1995  if (versionkey > 1000) {
1996  frombuf(buffer, &seekkey);
1997  frombuf(buffer, &seekpdir);
1998  } else {
1999  Int_t skey,sdir;
2000  frombuf(buffer, &skey); seekkey = (Long64_t)skey;
2001  frombuf(buffer, &sdir); seekpdir = (Long64_t)sdir;
2002  }
2003  frombuf(buffer, &nwhc);
2004  char *classname = 0;
2005  if (nwhc <= 0 || nwhc > 100) break;
2006  classname = new char[nwhc+1];
2007  int i, nwhci = nwhc;
2008  for (i = 0;i < nwhc; i++) frombuf(buffer, &classname[i]);
2009  classname[nwhci] = '\0';
2010  TDatime::GetDateTime(datime, date, time);
2011  TClass *tclass = TClass::GetClass(classname);
2012  if (seekpdir == fSeekDir && tclass && !tclass->InheritsFrom(TFile::Class())
2013  && strcmp(classname,"TBasket")) {
2014  key = new TKey(this);
2015  key->ReadKeyBuffer(bufread);
2016  if (!strcmp(key->GetName(),"StreamerInfo")) {
2017  fSeekInfo = seekkey;
2018  SafeDelete(fInfoCache);
2019  fNbytesInfo = nbytes;
2020  } else {
2021  AppendKey(key);
2022  nrecov++;
2023  SetBit(kRecovered);
2024  Info("Recover", "%s, recovered key %s:%s at address %lld",GetName(),key->GetClassName(),key->GetName(),idcur);
2025  }
2026  }
2027  delete [] classname;
2028  idcur += nbytes;
2029  }
2030  if (fWritable) {
2031  Long64_t max_file_size = Long64_t(kStartBigFile);
2032  if (max_file_size < fEND) max_file_size = fEND+1000000000;
2033  TFree *last = (TFree*)fFree->Last();
2034  if (last) {
2035  last->AddFree(fFree,fEND,max_file_size);
2036  } else {
2037  new TFree(fFree,fEND,max_file_size);
2038  }
2039  if (nrecov) Write();
2040  }
2041  return nrecov;
2042 }
2043 
2044 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2045 /// Reopen a file with a different access mode.
2046 ///
2047 /// For example, it is possible to change from READ to
2048 /// UPDATE or from NEW, CREATE, RECREATE, UPDATE to READ. Thus the
2049 /// mode argument can be either "READ" or "UPDATE". The method returns
2050 /// 0 in case the mode was successfully modified, 1 in case the mode
2051 /// did not change (was already as requested or wrong input arguments)
2052 /// and -1 in case of failure, in which case the file cannot be used
2053 /// anymore. The current directory (gFile) is changed to this file.
2054 
2055 Int_t TFile::ReOpen(Option_t *mode)
2056 {
2057  cd();
2058 
2059  TString opt = mode;
2060  opt.ToUpper();
2061 
2062  if (opt != "READ" && opt != "UPDATE") {
2063  Error("ReOpen", "mode must be either READ or UPDATE, not %s", opt.Data());
2064  return 1;
2065  }
2066 
2067  if (opt == fOption || (opt == "UPDATE" && fOption == "CREATE"))
2068  return 1;
2069 
2070  if (opt == "READ") {
2071  // switch to READ mode
2072 
2073  // flush data still in the pipeline and close the file
2074  if (IsOpen() && IsWritable()) {
2075  WriteStreamerInfo();
2076 
2077  // save directory key list and header
2078  Save();
2079 
2080  TFree *f1 = (TFree*)fFree->First();
2081  if (f1) {
2082  WriteFree(); // write free segments linked list
2083  WriteHeader(); // now write file header
2084  }
2085 
2086  FlushWriteCache();
2087 
2088  // delete free segments from free list
2089  if (fFree) {
2090  fFree->Delete();
2091  SafeDelete(fFree);
2092  }
2093 
2094  SysClose(fD);
2095  fD = -1;
2096 
2097  SetWritable(kFALSE);
2098  }
2099 
2100  // open in READ mode
2101  fOption = opt; // set fOption before SysOpen() for TNetFile
2102 #ifndef WIN32
2103  fD = SysOpen(fRealName, O_RDONLY, 0644);
2104 #else
2105  fD = SysOpen(fRealName, O_RDONLY | O_BINARY, S_IREAD | S_IWRITE);
2106 #endif
2107  if (fD == -1) {
2108  SysError("ReOpen", "file %s can not be opened in read mode", GetName());
2109  return -1;
2110  }
2111  SetWritable(kFALSE);
2112 
2113  } else {
2114  // switch to UPDATE mode
2115 
2116  // close readonly file
2117  if (IsOpen()) {
2118  SysClose(fD);
2119  fD = -1;
2120  }
2121 
2122  // open in UPDATE mode
2123  fOption = opt; // set fOption before SysOpen() for TNetFile
2124 #ifndef WIN32
2125  fD = SysOpen(fRealName, O_RDWR | O_CREAT, 0644);
2126 #else
2127  fD = SysOpen(fRealName, O_RDWR | O_CREAT | O_BINARY, S_IREAD | S_IWRITE);
2128 #endif
2129  if (fD == -1) {
2130  SysError("ReOpen", "file %s can not be opened in update mode", GetName());
2131  return -1;
2132  }
2133  SetWritable(kTRUE);
2134 
2135  fFree = new TList;
2136  if (fSeekFree > fBEGIN)
2137  ReadFree();
2138  else
2139  Warning("ReOpen","file %s probably not closed, cannot read free segments", GetName());
2140  }
2141 
2142  return 0;
2143 }
2144 
2145 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2146 /// Set position from where to start reading.
2147 
2148 void TFile::SetOffset(Long64_t offset, ERelativeTo pos)
2149 {
2150  switch (pos) {
2151  case kBeg:
2152  fOffset = offset + fArchiveOffset;
2153  break;
2154  case kCur:
2155  fOffset += offset;
2156  break;
2157  case kEnd:
2158  // this option is not used currently in the ROOT code
2159  if (fArchiveOffset)
2160  Error("SetOffset", "seeking from end in archive is not (yet) supported");
2161  fOffset = fEND + offset; // is fEND really EOF or logical EOF?
2162  break;
2163  }
2164 }
2165 
2166 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2167 /// Seek to a specific position in the file. Pos it either kBeg, kCur or kEnd.
2168 
2169 void TFile::Seek(Long64_t offset, ERelativeTo pos)
2170 {
2171  int whence = 0;
2172  switch (pos) {
2173  case kBeg:
2174  whence = SEEK_SET;
2175  offset += fArchiveOffset;
2176  break;
2177  case kCur:
2178  whence = SEEK_CUR;
2179  break;
2180  case kEnd:
2181  whence = SEEK_END;
2182  // this option is not used currently in the ROOT code
2183  if (fArchiveOffset)
2184  Error("Seek", "seeking from end in archive is not (yet) supported");
2185  break;
2186  }
2187  Long64_t retpos;
2188  if ((retpos = SysSeek(fD, offset, whence)) < 0)
2189  SysError("Seek", "cannot seek to position %lld in file %s, retpos=%lld",
2190  offset, GetName(), retpos);
2191 
2192  // used by TFileCacheRead::ReadBuffer()
2193  fOffset = retpos;
2194 }

2196 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2197 /// See comments for function SetCompressionSettings
2198 ///
2199 
2200 void TFile::SetCompressionAlgorithm(Int_t algorithm)
2201 {
2202  if (algorithm < 0 || algorithm >= ROOT::RCompressionSetting::EAlgorithm::kUndefined) algorithm = 0;
2203  if (fCompress < 0) {
2204  fCompress = 100 * algorithm + ROOT::RCompressionSetting::ELevel::kUseMin;
2205  } else {
2206  int level = fCompress % 100;
2207  fCompress = 100 * algorithm + level;
2208  }
2209 }
2210 
2211 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2212 /// See comments for function SetCompressionSettings
2213 
2214 void TFile::SetCompressionLevel(Int_t level)
2215 {
2216  if (level < 0) level = 0;
2217  if (level > 99) level = 99;
2218  if (fCompress < 0) {
2219  // if the algorithm is not defined yet use 0 as a default
2220  fCompress = level;
2221  } else {
2222  int algorithm = fCompress / 100;
2223  if (algorithm >= ROOT::RCompressionSetting::EAlgorithm::kUndefined) algorithm = 0;
2224  fCompress = 100 * algorithm + level;
2225  }
2226 }

2228 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2229 /// Used to specify the compression level and algorithm.
2230 ///
2231 /// See the TFile constructor for the details.
2232 
2233 void TFile::SetCompressionSettings(Int_t settings)
2234 {
2235  fCompress = settings;
2236 }
2237 
2238 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2239 /// Set a pointer to the read cache.
2240 ///
2241 /// <b>This relinquishes ownership</b> of the previous cache, so if you do not
2242 /// already have a pointer to the previous cache (and there was a previous
2243 /// cache), you ought to retrieve (and delete it if needed) using:
2244 ///
2245 /// TFileCacheRead *older = myfile->GetCacheRead();
2246 ///
2247 /// The action specifies how to behave when detaching a cache from the
2248 /// the TFile. If set to (default) kDisconnect, the contents of the cache
2249 /// will be flushed when it is removed from the file, and it will disconnect
2250 /// the cache object from the file. In almost all cases, this is what you want.
2251 /// If you want to disconnect the cache temporarily from this tree and re-attach
2252 /// later to the same fil, you can set action to kDoNotDisconnect. This will allow
2253 /// things like prefetching to continue in the background while it is no longer the
2254 /// default cache for the TTree. Except for a few expert use cases, kDisconnect is
2255 /// likely the correct setting.
2256 ///
2257 /// WARNING: if action=kDoNotDisconnect, you MUST delete the cache before TFile.
2258 ///
2259 
2260 void TFile::SetCacheRead(TFileCacheRead *cache, TObject* tree, ECacheAction action)
2261 {
2262  if (tree) {
2263  if (cache) fCacheReadMap->Add(tree, cache);
2264  else {
2265  // The only addition to fCacheReadMap is via an interface that takes
2266  // a TFileCacheRead* so the C-cast is safe.
2267  TFileCacheRead* tpf = (TFileCacheRead *)fCacheReadMap->GetValue(tree);
2268  fCacheReadMap->Remove(tree);
2269  if (tpf && (tpf->GetFile() == this) && (action != kDoNotDisconnect)) tpf->SetFile(0, action);
2270  }
2271  }
2272  if (cache) cache->SetFile(this, action);
2273  else if (!tree && fCacheRead && (action != kDoNotDisconnect)) fCacheRead->SetFile(0, action);
2274  // For backward compatibility the last Cache set is the default cache.
2275  fCacheRead = cache;
2276 }
2277

2279 /// Set a pointer to the write cache.
2280 ///
2281 /// If file is null the existing write cache is deleted.
2282 
2283 void TFile::SetCacheWrite(TFileCacheWrite *cache)
2284 {
2285  if (!cache && fCacheWrite) delete fCacheWrite;
2286  fCacheWrite = cache;
2287 }

2302  if (b.IsReading()) {
2303  b.ReadVersion(); //Version_t v = b.ReadVersion();
2304  } else {
2305  b.WriteVersion(TFile::IsA());

2309 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2310 /// Increment statistics for buffer sizes of objects in this file.
2311 
2312 void TFile::SumBuffer(Int_t bufsize)
2313 {
2314  fWritten++;
2315  fSumBuffer += double(bufsize);
2316  fSum2Buffer += double(bufsize) * double(bufsize); // avoid reaching MAXINT for temporary
2317 }
2318 
2319 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2320 /// Write memory objects to this file.
2321 ///
2322 /// Loop on all objects in memory (including subdirectories).
2323 /// A new key is created in the KEYS linked list for each object.
2324 /// The list of keys is then saved on the file (via WriteKeys)
2325 /// as a single data record.
2326 /// For values of opt see TObject::Write().
2327 /// The directory header info is rewritten on the directory header record.
2328 /// The linked list of FREE segments is written.
2329 /// The file header is written (bytes 1->fBEGIN).
2330 
2331 Int_t TFile::Write(const char *, Int_t opt, Int_t bufsiz)
2332 {
2333  if (!IsWritable()) {
2334  if (!TestBit(kWriteError)) {
2335  // Do not print the warning if we already had a SysError.
2336  Warning("Write", "file %s not opened in write mode", GetName());
2337  }
2338  return 0;
2339  }
2340 
2341  if (gDebug) {
2342  if (!GetTitle() || strlen(GetTitle()) == 0)
2343  Info("Write", "writing name = %s", GetName());
2344  else
2345  Info("Write", "writing name = %s title = %s", GetName(), GetTitle());
2346  }
2347 
2348  fMustFlush = kFALSE;
2349  Int_t nbytes = TDirectoryFile::Write(0, opt, bufsiz); // Write directory tree
2350  WriteStreamerInfo();
2351  WriteFree(); // Write free segments linked list
2352  WriteHeader(); // Now write file header
2353  fMustFlush = kTRUE;
2354 
2355  return nbytes;
2356 }
