2358 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2359 /// One can not save a const TDirectory object.
2360 
2361 Int_t TFile::Write(const char *n, Int_t opt, Int_t bufsize) const
2362 {
2363  Error("Write const","A const TFile object should not be saved. We try to proceed anyway.");
2364  return const_cast<TFile*>(this)->Write(n, opt, bufsize);
2365 }
2366 
2367 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2368 /// Write a buffer to the file. This is the basic low level write operation.
2369 /// Returns kTRUE in case of failure.
2370 
2371 Bool_t TFile::WriteBuffer(const char *buf, Int_t len)
2372 {
2373  if (IsOpen() && fWritable) {
2374 
2375  Int_t st;
2376  if ((st = WriteBufferViaCache(buf, len))) {
2377  if (st == 2)
2378  return kTRUE;
2379  return kFALSE;
2380  }
2381 
2382  ssize_t siz;
2383  gSystem->IgnoreInterrupt();
2384  while ((siz = SysWrite(fD, buf, len)) < 0 && GetErrno() == EINTR)
2385  ResetErrno();
2386  gSystem->IgnoreInterrupt(kFALSE);
2387  if (siz < 0) {
2388  // Write the system error only once for this file
2389  SetBit(kWriteError); SetWritable(kFALSE);
2390  SysError("WriteBuffer", "error writing to file %s (%ld)", GetName(), (Long_t)siz);
2391  return kTRUE;
2392  }
2393  if (siz != len) {
2394  SetBit(kWriteError);
2395  Error("WriteBuffer", "error writing all requested bytes to file %s, wrote %ld of %d",
2396  GetName(), (Long_t)siz, len);
2397  return kTRUE;
2398  }
2399  fBytesWrite += siz;
2400  fgBytesWrite += siz;
2401 
2402  if (gMonitoringWriter)
2403  gMonitoringWriter->SendFileWriteProgress(this);
2404 
2405  return kFALSE;
2406  }
2407  return kTRUE;
2408 }
2409 
2410 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2411 /// Write buffer via cache. Returns 0 if cache is not active, 1 in case
2412 /// write via cache was successful, 2 in case write via cache failed.
2413 
2414 Int_t TFile::WriteBufferViaCache(const char *buf, Int_t len)
2415 {
2416  if (!fCacheWrite) return 0;
2417 
2418  Int_t st;
2419  Long64_t off = GetRelOffset();
2420  if ((st = fCacheWrite->WriteBuffer(buf, off, len)) < 0) {
2421  SetBit(kWriteError);
2422  Error("WriteBuffer", "error writing to cache");
2423  return 2;
2424  }
2425  if (st > 0) {
2426  // fOffset might have been changed via TFileCacheWrite::WriteBuffer(), reset it
2427  Seek(off + len);
2428  return 1;
2429  }
2430  return 0;
2431 }
2432 
2433 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2434 /// Write FREE linked list on the file.
2435 /// The linked list of FREE segments (fFree) is written as a single data
2436 /// record.
2437 
2438 void TFile::WriteFree()
2439 {
2440  //*-* Delete old record if it exists
2441  if (fSeekFree != 0) {
2442  MakeFree(fSeekFree, fSeekFree + fNbytesFree -1);
2443  }
2444 
2445  Bool_t largeFile = (fEND > TFile::kStartBigFile);
2446 
2447  auto createKey = [this]() {
2448  Int_t nbytes = 0;
2449  TFree *afree;
2450  TIter next (fFree);
2451  while ((afree = (TFree*) next())) {
2452  nbytes += afree->Sizeof();
2453  }
2454  if (!nbytes) return (TKey*)nullptr;
2455 
2456  TKey *key = new TKey(fName,fTitle,IsA(),nbytes,this);
2457 
2458  if (key->GetSeekKey() == 0) {
2459  delete key;
2460  return (TKey*)nullptr;
2461  }
2462  return key;
2463  };
2464 
2465  TKey *key = createKey();
2466  if (!key) return;
2467 
2468  if (!largeFile && (fEND > TFile::kStartBigFile)) {
2469  // The free block list is large enough to bring the file to larger
2470  // than 2Gb, the references/offsets are now 64bits in the output
2471  // so we need to redo the calculattion since the list of free block
2472  // information will not fit in the original size.
2473  key->Delete();
2474  delete key;
2475 
2476  key = createKey();
2477  if (!key) return;
2478  }
2479 
2480  Int_t nbytes = key->GetObjlen();
2481  char *buffer = key->GetBuffer();
2482  char *start = buffer;
2483 
2484  TIter next (fFree);
2485  TFree *afree;
2486  while ((afree = (TFree*) next())) {
2487  // We could 'waste' time here and double check that
2488  // (buffer+afree->Sizeof() < (start+nbytes)
2489  afree->FillBuffer(buffer);
2490  }
2491  auto actualBytes = buffer-start;
2492  if ( actualBytes != nbytes ) {
2493  if (actualBytes < nbytes) {
2494  // Most likely one of the 'free' segment was used to store this
2495  // TKey, so we had one less TFree to store than we planned.
2496  memset(buffer,0,nbytes-actualBytes);
2497  } else {
2498  Error("WriteFree","The free block list TKey wrote more data than expected (%d vs %ld). Most likely there has been an out-of-bound write.",nbytes,(long int)actualBytes);
2499  }
2500  }
2501  fNbytesFree = key->GetNbytes();
2502  fSeekFree = key->GetSeekKey();
2503  key->WriteFile();
2504  delete key;
2505 }
2506 
2507 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2508 /// Write File Header.
2509 
2510 void TFile::WriteHeader()
2511 {
2512  SafeDelete(fInfoCache);
2513  TFree *lastfree = (TFree*)fFree->Last();
2514  if (lastfree) fEND = lastfree->GetFirst();
2515  const char *root = "root";
2516  char *psave = new char[fBEGIN];
2517  char *buffer = psave;
2518  Int_t nfree = fFree->GetSize();
2519  memcpy(buffer, root, 4); buffer += 4;
2520  Int_t version = fVersion;
2521  if (version <1000000 && fEND > kStartBigFile) {version += 1000000; fUnits = 8;}
2522  tobuf(buffer, version);
2523  tobuf(buffer, (Int_t)fBEGIN);
2524  if (version < 1000000) {
2525  tobuf(buffer, (Int_t)fEND);
2526  tobuf(buffer, (Int_t)fSeekFree);
2527  tobuf(buffer, fNbytesFree);
2528  tobuf(buffer, nfree);
2529  tobuf(buffer, fNbytesName);
2530  tobuf(buffer, fUnits);
2531  tobuf(buffer, fCompress);
2532  tobuf(buffer, (Int_t)fSeekInfo);
2533  tobuf(buffer, fNbytesInfo);
2534  } else {
2535  tobuf(buffer, fEND);
2536  tobuf(buffer, fSeekFree);
2537  tobuf(buffer, fNbytesFree);
2538  tobuf(buffer, nfree);
2539  tobuf(buffer, fNbytesName);
2540  tobuf(buffer, fUnits);
2541  tobuf(buffer, fCompress);
2542  tobuf(buffer, fSeekInfo);
2543  tobuf(buffer, fNbytesInfo);
2544  }
2545  fUUID.FillBuffer(buffer);
2546  Int_t nbytes = buffer - psave;
2547  Seek(0);
2548  WriteBuffer(psave, nbytes);
2549  Flush(); // Intentionally not conditional on fMustFlush, this is the 'obligatory' flush.
2550  delete [] psave;
2551 }
2552 
2553 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2554 /// Generate source code necessary to access the objects stored in the file.
2555 ///
2556 /// Generate code in directory dirname for all classes specified in
2557 /// argument classes If classes = "*" (default and currently the
2558 /// only supported value), the function generates an include file
2559 /// for each class in the StreamerInfo list for which a TClass
2560 /// object does not exist.
2561 ///
2562 /// The code generated includes:
2563 /// - <em>dirnameProjectHeaders.h</em>, which contains one #include statement per generated header file
2564 /// - <em>dirnameProjectSource.cxx</em>,which contains all the constructors and destructors implementation.
2565 /// and one header per class that is not nested inside another class.
2566 /// The header file name is the fully qualified name of the class after all the special characters
2567 /// "<>,:" are replaced by underscored. For example for std::pair<edm::Vertex,int> the file name is
2568 /// pair_edm__Vertex_int_.h
2569 ///
2570 /// In the generated classes, map, multimap when the first template parameter is a class
2571 /// are replaced by a vector of pair. set and multiset when the tempalte parameter
2572 /// is a class are replaced by a vector. This is required since we do not have the
2573 /// code needed to order and/or compare the object of the classes.
2574 /// This is a quick explanation of the options available:
2575 /// Option | Details
2576 /// -------|--------
2577 /// new (default) | A new directory dirname is created. If dirname already exist, an error message is printed and the function returns.
2578 /// recreate | If dirname does not exist, it is created (like in "new"). If dirname already exist, all existing files in dirname are deleted before creating the new files.
2579 /// update | New classes are added to the existing directory. Existing classes with the same name are replaced by the new definition. If the directory dirname doest not exist, same effect as "new".
2580 /// genreflex | Use genreflex rather than rootcint to generate the dictionary.
2581 /// par | Create a PAR file with the minimal set of code needed to read the content of the ROOT file. The name of the PAR file is basename(dirname), with extension '.par' enforced; the PAR file will be created at dirname(dirname).
2582 ///
2583 /// If, in addition to one of the 3 above options, the option "+" is specified,
2584 /// the function will generate:
2585 /// - a script called MAKEP to build the shared lib
2586 /// - a dirnameLinkDef.h file
2587 /// - rootcint will be run to generate a dirnameProjectDict.cxx file
2588 /// - dirnameProjectDict.cxx will be compiled with the current options in compiledata.h
2589 /// - a shared lib dirname.so will be created.
2590 /// If the option "++" is specified, the generated shared lib is dynamically
2591 /// linked with the current executable module.
2592 /// If the option "+" and "nocompile" are specified, the utility files are generated
2593 /// as in the option "+" but they are not executed.
2594 /// Example:
2595 /// file.MakeProject("demo","*","recreate++");
2596 /// - creates a new directory demo unless it already exist
2597 /// - clear the previous directory content
2598 /// - generate the xxx.h files for all classes xxx found in this file
2599 /// and not yet known to the CINT dictionary.
2600 /// - creates the build script MAKEP
2601 /// - creates a LinkDef.h file
2602 /// - runs rootcint generating demoProjectDict.cxx
2603 /// - compiles demoProjectDict.cxx into demoProjectDict.o
2604 /// - generates a shared lib demo.so
2605 /// - dynamically links the shared lib demo.so to the executable
2606 /// If only the option "+" had been specified, one can still link the
2607 /// shared lib to the current executable module with:
2608 ///
2609 /// gSystem->load("demo/demo.so");
2610 ///
2611 /// The following feature is not yet enabled:
2612 /// One can restrict the list of classes to be generated by using expressions like:
2613 ///
2614 /// classes = "Ali*" generate code only for classes starting with Ali
2615 /// classes = "myClass" generate code for class MyClass only.
2616 ///
2617 
2618 void TFile::MakeProject(const char *dirname, const char * /*classes*/,
2619  Option_t *option)
2620 {
2621  TString opt = option;
2622  opt.ToLower();
2623  Bool_t makepar = kFALSE;
2624  TString parname, pardir;
2625  if (opt.Contains("par")) {
2626  // Create a PAR file
2627  parname = gSystem->BaseName(dirname);
2628  if (parname.EndsWith(".par")) parname.ReplaceAll(".par","");
2629  pardir = gSystem->DirName(dirname);
2630  // Cleanup or prepare the dirs
2631  TString path, filepath;
2632  void *dir = gSystem->OpenDirectory(pardir);
2633  if (dir) {
2634  path.Form("%s/%s", pardir.Data(), parname.Data());
2635  void *dirp = gSystem->OpenDirectory(path);
2636  if (dirp) {
2637  path += "/PROOF-INF";
2638  void *dirinf = gSystem->OpenDirectory(path);
2639  const char *afile = 0;
2640  if (dirinf) {
2641  while ((afile = gSystem->GetDirEntry(dirinf))) {
2642  if (strcmp(afile,".") == 0) continue;
2643  if (strcmp(afile,"..") == 0) continue;
2644  filepath.Form("%s/%s", path.Data(), afile);
2645  if (gSystem->Unlink(filepath))
2646  Warning("MakeProject", "1: problems unlinking '%s' ('%s', '%s')", filepath.Data(), path.Data(), afile);
2647  }
2648  gSystem->FreeDirectory(dirinf);
2649  }
2650  gSystem->Unlink(path);
2651  path.Form("%s/%s", pardir.Data(), parname.Data());
2652  while ((afile = gSystem->GetDirEntry(dirp))) {
2653  if (strcmp(afile,".") == 0) continue;
2654  if (strcmp(afile,"..") == 0) continue;
2655  filepath.Form("%s/%s", path.Data(), afile);
2656  if (gSystem->Unlink(filepath))
2657  Warning("MakeProject", "2: problems unlinking '%s' ('%s', '%s')", filepath.Data(), path.Data(), afile);
2658  }
2659  gSystem->FreeDirectory(dirp);
2660  if (gSystem->Unlink(path))
2661  Warning("MakeProject", "problems unlinking '%s'", path.Data());
2662  }
2663  }
2664  // Make sure that the relevant dirs exists: this is mandatory, so we fail if unsuccessful
2665  path.Form("%s/%s/PROOF-INF", pardir.Data(), parname.Data());
2666  if (gSystem->mkdir(path, kTRUE)) {
2667  Error("MakeProject", "problems creating '%s'", path.Data());
2668  return;
2669  }
2670  makepar = kTRUE;
2671 
2672  } else {
2673  void *dir = gSystem->OpenDirectory(dirname);
2674  TString dirpath;
2675 
2676  if (opt.Contains("update")) {
2677  // check that directory exist, if not create it
2678  if (dir == 0) {
2679  gSystem->mkdir(dirname);
2680  }
2681 
2682  } else if (opt.Contains("recreate")) {
2683  // check that directory exist, if not create it
2684  if (dir == 0) {
2685  if (gSystem->mkdir(dirname) < 0) {
2686  Error("MakeProject","cannot create directory '%s'",dirname);
2687  return;
2688  }
2689  }
2690  // clear directory
2691  while (dir) {
2692  const char *afile = gSystem->GetDirEntry(dir);
2693  if (afile == 0) break;
2694  if (strcmp(afile,".") == 0) continue;
2695  if (strcmp(afile,"..") == 0) continue;
2696  dirpath.Form("%s/%s",dirname,afile);
2697  gSystem->Unlink(dirpath);
2698  }
2699 
2700  } else {
2701  // new is assumed
2702  // if directory already exist, print error message and return
2703  if (dir) {
2704  Error("MakeProject","cannot create directory %s, already existing",dirname);
2705  gSystem->FreeDirectory(dir);
2706  return;
2707  }
2708  if (gSystem->mkdir(dirname) < 0) {
2709  Error("MakeProject","cannot create directory '%s'",dirname);
2710  return;
2711  }
2712  }
2713  if (dir) {
2714  gSystem->FreeDirectory(dir);
2715  }
2716  }
2717  Bool_t genreflex = opt.Contains("genreflex");
2718 
2719  // we are now ready to generate the classes
2720  // loop on all TStreamerInfo
2721  TList *filelist = (TList*)GetStreamerInfoCache();
2722  if (filelist) filelist = (TList*)filelist->Clone();
2723  if (filelist == 0) {
2724  Error("MakeProject","file %s has no StreamerInfo", GetName());
2725  return;
2726  }
2727 
2728  TString clean_dirname(dirname);
2729  if (makepar) clean_dirname.Form("%s/%s", pardir.Data(), parname.Data());
2730  if (clean_dirname[clean_dirname.Length()-1]=='/') {
2731  clean_dirname.Remove(clean_dirname.Length()-1);
2732  } else if (clean_dirname[clean_dirname.Length()-1]=='\\') {
2733  clean_dirname.Remove(clean_dirname.Length()-1);
2734  if (clean_dirname[clean_dirname.Length()-1]=='\\') {
2735  clean_dirname.Remove(clean_dirname.Length()-1);
2736  }
2737  }
2738  TString subdirname( gSystem->BaseName(clean_dirname) );
2739  if (makepar) subdirname = parname;
2740  if (subdirname == "") {
2741  Error("MakeProject","Directory name must not be empty.");
2742  return;
2743  }
2744 
2745  // Start the source file
2746  TString spath; spath.Form("%s/%sProjectSource.cxx",clean_dirname.Data(),subdirname.Data());
2747  FILE *sfp = fopen(spath.Data(),"w");
2748  if (sfp ==0) {
2749  Error("MakeProject","Unable to create the source file %s.",spath.Data());
2750  return;
2751  }
2752  fprintf(sfp, "namespace std {}\nusing namespace std;\n");
2753  fprintf(sfp, "#include \"%sProjectHeaders.h\"\n\n",subdirname.Data() );
2754  if (!genreflex) fprintf(sfp, "#include \"%sLinkDef.h\"\n\n",subdirname.Data() );
2755  fprintf(sfp, "#include \"%sProjectDict.cxx\"\n\n",subdirname.Data() );
2756  fprintf(sfp, "struct DeleteObjectFunctor {\n");
2757  fprintf(sfp, " template <typename T>\n");
2758  fprintf(sfp, " void operator()(const T *ptr) const {\n");
2759  fprintf(sfp, " delete ptr;\n");
2760  fprintf(sfp, " }\n");
2761  fprintf(sfp, " template <typename T, typename Q>\n");
2762  fprintf(sfp, " void operator()(const std::pair<T,Q> &) const {\n");
2763  fprintf(sfp, " // Do nothing\n");
2764  fprintf(sfp, " }\n");
2765  fprintf(sfp, " template <typename T, typename Q>\n");
2766  fprintf(sfp, " void operator()(const std::pair<T,Q*> &ptr) const {\n");
2767  fprintf(sfp, " delete ptr.second;\n");
2768  fprintf(sfp, " }\n");
2769  fprintf(sfp, " template <typename T, typename Q>\n");
2770  fprintf(sfp, " void operator()(const std::pair<T*,Q> &ptr) const {\n");
2771  fprintf(sfp, " delete ptr.first;\n");
2772  fprintf(sfp, " }\n");
2773  fprintf(sfp, " template <typename T, typename Q>\n");
2774  fprintf(sfp, " void operator()(const std::pair<T*,Q*> &ptr) const {\n");
2775  fprintf(sfp, " delete ptr.first;\n");
2776  fprintf(sfp, " delete ptr.second;\n");
2777  fprintf(sfp, " }\n");
2778  fprintf(sfp, "};\n\n");
2779  fclose( sfp );
2780 
2781  // loop on all TStreamerInfo classes to check for empty classes
2782  // and enums listed either as data member or template parameters,
2783  // and filter out 'duplicates' classes/streamerInfos.
2784  TStreamerInfo *info;
2785  TIter flnext(filelist);
2786  TList extrainfos;
2787  TList *list = new TList();
2788  while ((info = (TStreamerInfo*)flnext())) {
2789  if (info->IsA() != TStreamerInfo::Class()) {
2790  continue;
2791  }
2792  if (strstr(info->GetName(),"@@")) {
2793  // Skip schema evolution support streamerInfo
2794  continue;
2795  }
2796  TClass *cl = TClass::GetClass(info->GetName());
2797  if (cl) {
2798  if (cl->HasInterpreterInfo()) continue; // skip known classes
2799  }
2800  // Find and use the proper rules for the TStreamerInfos.
2801  TMakeProject::GenerateMissingStreamerInfos( &extrainfos, info->GetName() );
2802  TIter enext( info->GetElements() );
2803  TStreamerElement *el;
2804  ROOT::Detail::TSchemaRuleSet::TMatches rules;
2805  if (cl && cl->GetSchemaRules()) {
2806  rules = cl->GetSchemaRules()->FindRules(cl->GetName(), info->GetClassVersion());
2807  }
2808  while( (el=(TStreamerElement*)enext()) ) {
2809  for(auto rule : rules) {
2810  if( rule->IsRenameRule() || rule->IsAliasRule() )
2811  continue;
2812  // Check whether this is an 'attribute' rule.
2813  if ( rule->HasTarget( el->GetName()) && rule->GetAttributes()[0] != 0 ) {
2814  TString attr( rule->GetAttributes() );
2815  attr.ToLower();
2816  if (attr.Contains("owner")) {
2817  if (attr.Contains("notowner")) {
2818  el->SetBit(TStreamerElement::kDoNotDelete);
2819  } else {
2820  el->ResetBit(TStreamerElement::kDoNotDelete);
2821  }
2822  }
2823  }
2824  }
2825  TMakeProject::GenerateMissingStreamerInfos(&extrainfos, el);
2826  }
2827  TVirtualStreamerInfo *alternate = (TVirtualStreamerInfo*)list->FindObject(info->GetName());
2828  if (alternate) {
2829  if ((info->GetClass() && info->GetClassVersion() == info->GetClass()->GetClassVersion())
2830  || (info->GetClassVersion() > alternate->GetClassVersion()) ) {
2831  list->AddAfter(alternate, info);
2832  list->Remove(alternate);
2833  } // otherwise ignore this info as not being the official one.
2834  } else {
2835  list->Add(info);
2836  }
2837  }
2838  // Now transfer the new StreamerInfo onto the main list and
2839  // to the owning list.
2840  TIter nextextra(&extrainfos);
2841  while ((info = (TStreamerInfo*)nextextra())) {
2842  list->Add(info);
2843  filelist->Add(info);
2844  }
2845 
2846  // loop on all TStreamerInfo classes
2847  TIter next(list);
2848  Int_t ngener = 0;
2849  while ((info = (TStreamerInfo*)next())) {
2850  if (info->IsA() != TStreamerInfo::Class()) {
2851  continue;
2852  }
2853  if (info->GetClassVersion()==-4) continue; // Skip outer level namespace
2854  TIter subnext(list);
2855  TStreamerInfo *subinfo;
2856  TList subClasses;
2857  Int_t len = strlen(info->GetName());
2858  while ((subinfo = (TStreamerInfo*)subnext())) {
2859  if (subinfo->IsA() != TStreamerInfo::Class()) {
2860  continue;
2861  }
2862  if (strncmp(info->GetName(),subinfo->GetName(),len)==0) {
2863  // The 'sub' StreamerInfo start with the main StreamerInfo name,
2864  // it subinfo is likely to be a nested class.
2865  const Int_t sublen = strlen(subinfo->GetName());
2866  if ( (sublen > len) && subinfo->GetName()[len+1]==':'
2867  && !subClasses.FindObject(subinfo->GetName()) /* We need to insure uniqueness */)
2868  {
2869  subClasses.Add(subinfo);
2870  }
2871  }
2872  }
2873  ngener += info->GenerateHeaderFile(clean_dirname.Data(),&subClasses,&extrainfos);
2874  subClasses.Clear("nodelete");
2875  }
2876  extrainfos.Clear("nodelete"); // We are done with this list.
2877 
2878  TString path;
2879  path.Form("%s/%sProjectHeaders.h",clean_dirname.Data(),subdirname.Data());
2880  FILE *allfp = fopen(path,"a");
2881  if (!allfp) {
2882  Error("MakeProject","Cannot open output file:%s\n",path.Data());
2883  } else {
2884  fprintf(allfp,"#include \"%sProjectInstances.h\"\n", subdirname.Data());
2885  fclose(allfp);
2886  }
2887 
2888  printf("MakeProject has generated %d classes in %s\n",ngener,clean_dirname.Data());
2889 
2890  // generate the shared lib
2891  if (!opt.Contains("+") && !makepar) {
2892  delete list;
2893  filelist->Delete();
2894  delete filelist;
2895  return;
2896  }
2897 
2898  // Makefiles files
2899  FILE *fpMAKE = 0;
2900  if (!makepar) {
2901  // Create the MAKEP file by looping on all *.h files
2902  // delete MAKEP if it already exists
2903 #ifdef WIN32
2904  path.Form("%s/makep.cmd",clean_dirname.Data());
2905 #else
2906  path.Form("%s/MAKEP",clean_dirname.Data());
2907 #endif
2908 #ifdef R__WINGCC
2909  fpMAKE = fopen(path,"wb");
2910 #else
2911  fpMAKE = fopen(path,"w");
2912 #endif
2913  if (!fpMAKE) {
2914  Error("MakeProject", "cannot open file %s", path.Data());
2915  delete list;
2916  filelist->Delete();
2917  delete filelist;
2918  return;
2919  }
2920  }
2921 
2922  // Add rootcint/genreflex statement generating ProjectDict.cxx
2923  FILE *ifp = 0;
2924  path.Form("%s/%sProjectInstances.h",clean_dirname.Data(),subdirname.Data());
2925 #ifdef R__WINGCC
2926  ifp = fopen(path,"wb");
2927 #else
2928  ifp = fopen(path,"w");
2929 #endif
2930  if (!ifp) {
2931  Error("MakeProject", "cannot open path file %s", path.Data());
2932  delete list;
2933  filelist->Delete();
2934  delete filelist;
2935  fclose(fpMAKE);
2936  return;
2937  }
2938 
2939  if (!makepar) {
2940  if (genreflex) {
2941  fprintf(fpMAKE,"genreflex %sProjectHeaders.h -o %sProjectDict.cxx --comments --iocomments %s ",subdirname.Data(),subdirname.Data(),gSystem->GetIncludePath());
2942  path.Form("%s/%sSelection.xml",clean_dirname.Data(),subdirname.Data());
2943  } else {
2944  fprintf(fpMAKE,"rootcint -v1 -f %sProjectDict.cxx -c %s ", subdirname.Data(), gSystem->GetIncludePath());
2945  path.Form("%s/%sLinkDef.h",clean_dirname.Data(),subdirname.Data());
2946  }
2947  } else {
2948  path.Form("%s/%sLinkDef.h",clean_dirname.Data(),subdirname.Data());
2949  }
2950 
2951  // Create the LinkDef.h or xml selection file by looping on all *.h files
2952  // replace any existing file.
2953 #ifdef R__WINGCC
2954  FILE *fp = fopen(path,"wb");
2955 #else
2956  FILE *fp = fopen(path,"w");
2957 #endif
2958  if (!fp) {
2959  Error("MakeProject", "cannot open path file %s", path.Data());
2960  delete list;
2961  filelist->Delete();
2962  delete filelist;
2963  fclose(fpMAKE);
2964  fclose(ifp);
2965  return;
2966  }
2967  if (genreflex) {
2968  fprintf(fp,"<lcgdict>\n");
2969  fprintf(fp,"\n");
2970  } else {
2971  fprintf(fp,"#ifdef __CINT__\n");
2972  fprintf(fp,"\n");
2973  }
2974 
2975  TString tmp;
2976  TString instances;
2977  TString selections;
2978  next.Reset();
2979  while ((info = (TStreamerInfo*)next())) {
2980  if (info->IsA() != TStreamerInfo::Class()) {
2981  continue;
2982  }
2983  if (strncmp(info->GetName(), "auto_ptr<", strlen("auto_ptr<")) == 0) {
2984  continue;
2985  }
2986  TClass *cl = TClass::GetClass(info->GetName());
2987  if (cl) {
2988  if (cl->HasInterpreterInfo()) continue; // skip known classes
2989  if (cl->GetSchemaRules()) {
2990  auto rules = cl->GetSchemaRules()->FindRules(cl->GetName(), info->GetClassVersion());
2991  TString strrule;
2992  for(auto rule : rules) {
2993  strrule.Clear();
2994  if (genreflex) {
2995  rule->AsString(strrule,"x");
2996  strrule.Append("\n");
2997  if ( selections.Index(strrule) == kNPOS ) {
2998  selections.Append(strrule);
2999  }
3000  } else {
3001  rule->AsString(strrule);
3002  if (strncmp(strrule.Data(),"type=",5)==0) {
3003  strrule.Remove(0,5);
3004  }
3005  fprintf(fp,"#pragma %s;\n",strrule.Data());
3006  }
3007  }
3008  }
3009 
3010  }
3011  if ((info->GetClass() && info->GetClass()->GetCollectionType()) || TClassEdit::IsSTLCont(info->GetName())) {
3012  std::vector<std::string> inside;
3013  int nestedLoc;
3014  TClassEdit::GetSplit( info->GetName(), inside, nestedLoc, TClassEdit::kLong64 );
3015  Int_t stlkind = TClassEdit::STLKind(inside[0]);
3016  TClass *key = TClass::GetClass(inside[1].c_str());
3017  if (key) {
3018  TString what;
3019  switch ( stlkind ) {
3020  case ROOT::kSTLmap:
3021  case ROOT::kSTLmultimap:
3022  if (TClass::GetClass(inside[1].c_str())) {
3023  what = "std::pair<";
3024  what += TMakeProject::UpdateAssociativeToVector( inside[1].c_str() );
3025  what += ",";
3026  what += TMakeProject::UpdateAssociativeToVector( inside[2].c_str() );
3027  if (what[what.Length()-1]=='>') {
3028  what += " >";
3029  } else {
3030  what += ">";
3031  }
3032  if (genreflex) {
3033  tmp.Form("<class name=\"%s\" />\n",what.Data());
3034  if ( selections.Index(tmp) == kNPOS ) {
3035  selections.Append(tmp);
3036  }
3037  tmp.Form("template class %s;\n",what.Data());
3038  if ( instances.Index(tmp) == kNPOS ) {
3039  instances.Append(tmp);
3040  }
3041  } else {
3042  what.ReplaceAll("std::","");
3043  TClass *paircl = TClass::GetClass(what.Data());
3044  if (paircl == 0 || !paircl->HasInterpreterInfo()) {
3045  fprintf(fp,"#pragma link C++ class %s+;\n",what.Data());
3046  }
3047  }
3048  break;
3049  }
3050  default:
3051  if (strncmp(key->GetName(),"pair<",strlen("pair<"))==0) {
3052  if (genreflex) {
3053  tmp.Form("<class name=\"%s\" />\n",key->GetName());
3054  if ( selections.Index(tmp) == kNPOS ) {
3055  selections.Append(tmp);
3056  }
3057  tmp.Form("template class %s;\n",key->GetName());
3058  if ( instances.Index(tmp) == kNPOS ) {
3059  instances.Append(tmp);
3060  }
3061  } else {
3062  what.ReplaceAll("std::","");
3063  fprintf(fp,"#pragma link C++ class %s+;\n",key->GetName());
3064  }
3065  }
3066  break;
3067  }
3068  }
3069  continue;
3070  }
3071  {
3072  TString what(TMakeProject::UpdateAssociativeToVector(info->GetName()).Data());
3073  if (genreflex) {
3074  tmp.Form("<class name=\"%s\" />\n",what.Data());
3075  if ( selections.Index(tmp) == kNPOS ) {
3076  selections.Append(tmp);
3077  }
3078  if (what[what.Length()-1] == '>') {
3079  tmp.Form("template class %s;\n",what.Data());
3080  if ( instances.Index(tmp) == kNPOS ) {
3081  instances.Append(tmp);
3082  }
3083  }
3084  } else {
3085  what.ReplaceAll("std::","");
3086  fprintf(fp,"#pragma link C++ class %s+;\n",what.Data());
3087  }
3088  }
3089  if (genreflex) {
3090  // Also request the dictionary for the STL container used as members ...
3091  TIter eliter( info->GetElements() );
3092  TStreamerElement *element;
3093  while( (element = (TStreamerElement*)eliter() ) ) {
3094  if (element->GetClass() && !element->GetClass()->IsLoaded() && element->GetClass()->GetCollectionProxy()) {
3095  TString what( TMakeProject::UpdateAssociativeToVector(element->GetClass()->GetName()) );
3096  tmp.Form("<class name=\"%s\" />\n",what.Data());
3097  if ( selections.Index(tmp) == kNPOS ) {
3098  selections.Append(tmp);
3099  }
3100  tmp.Form("template class %s;\n",what.Data());
3101  if ( instances.Index(tmp) == kNPOS ) {
3102  instances.Append(tmp);
3103  }
3104  }
3105  }
3106  }
3107  }
3108  if (genreflex) {
3109  fprintf(ifp,"#ifndef PROJECT_INSTANCES_H\n");
3110  fprintf(ifp,"#define PROJECT_INSTANCES_H\n");
3111  fprintf(ifp,"%s",instances.Data());
3112  fprintf(ifp,"#endif\n");
3113  fprintf(fp,"%s",selections.Data());
3114  fprintf(fp,"</lcgdict>\n");
3115  } else {

3489 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
3490 /// Read the list of StreamerInfo from this file.
3491 ///
3492 /// The key with name holding the list of TStreamerInfo objects is read.
3493 /// The corresponding TClass objects are updated.
3494 /// Note that this function is not called if the static member fgReadInfo is false.
3495 /// (see TFile::SetReadStreamerInfo)
3496 
3497 void TFile::ReadStreamerInfo()
3498 {
3499  auto listRetcode = GetStreamerInfoListImpl(/*lookupSICache*/ true);
3500  TList *list = listRetcode.fList;
3501  auto retcode = listRetcode.fReturnCode;
3502  if (!list) {
3503  if (retcode) MakeZombie();
3504  return;
3505  }
3506 
3507  list->SetOwner(kFALSE);
3508 
3509  if (gDebug > 0) Info("ReadStreamerInfo", "called for file %s",GetName());
3510 
3511  TStreamerInfo *info;
3512 
3513  Int_t version = fVersion;
3514  if (version > 1000000) version -= 1000000;
3515  if (version < 53419 || (59900 < version && version < 59907)) {
3516  // We need to update the fCheckSum field of the TStreamerBase.
3517 
3518  // loop on all TStreamerInfo classes
3519  TObjLink *lnk = list->FirstLink();
3520  while (lnk) {
3521  info = (TStreamerInfo*)lnk->GetObject();
3522  if (info == 0 || info->IsA() != TStreamerInfo::Class()) {
3523  lnk = lnk->Next();
3524  continue;
3525  }
3526  TIter next(info->GetElements());
3527  TStreamerElement *element;
3528  while ((element = (TStreamerElement*) next())) {
3529  TStreamerBase *base = dynamic_cast<TStreamerBase*>(element);
3530  if (!base) continue;
3531  if (base->GetBaseCheckSum() != 0) continue;
3532  TStreamerInfo *baseinfo = (TStreamerInfo*)list->FindObject(base->GetName());
3533  if (baseinfo) {
3534  base->SetBaseCheckSum(baseinfo->GetCheckSum());
3535  }
3536  }
3537  lnk = lnk->Next();
3538  }
3539  }
3540 
3541  // loop on all TStreamerInfo classes
3542  for (int mode=0;mode<2; ++mode) {
3543  // In order for the collection proxy to be initialized properly, we need
3544  // to setup the TStreamerInfo for non-stl class before the stl classes.
3545  TObjLink *lnk = list->FirstLink();
3546  while (lnk) {
3547  info = (TStreamerInfo*)lnk->GetObject();
3548  if (info == 0) {
3549  lnk = lnk->Next();
3550  continue;
3551  }
3552  if (info->IsA() != TStreamerInfo::Class()) {
3553  if (mode==1) {
3554  TObject *obj = (TObject*)info;
3555  if (strcmp(obj->GetName(),"listOfRules")==0) {
3556 #if 0
3557  // Completely ignore the rules for now.
3558  TList *listOfRules = (TList*)obj;
3559  TObjLink *rulelnk = listOfRules->FirstLink();
3560  while (rulelnk) {
3561  TObjString *rule = (TObjString*)rulelnk->GetObject();
3562  TClass::AddRule( rule->String().Data() );
3563  rulelnk = rulelnk->Next();
3564  }
3565 #endif
3566  } else {
3567  Warning("ReadStreamerInfo","%s has a %s in the list of TStreamerInfo.", GetName(), info->IsA()->GetName());
3568  }
3569  info->SetBit(kCanDelete);
3570  }
3571  lnk = lnk->Next();
3572  continue;
3573  }
3574  // This is a quick way (instead of parsing the name) to see if this is
3575  // the description of an STL container.
3576  if (info->GetElements()==0) {
3577  Warning("ReadStreamerInfo","The StreamerInfo for %s does not have a list of elements.",info->GetName());
3578  lnk = lnk->Next();
3579  continue;
3580  }
3581  TObject *element = info->GetElements()->UncheckedAt(0);
3582  Bool_t isstl = element && strcmp("This",element->GetName())==0;
3583 
3584  if ( (!isstl && mode ==0) || (isstl && mode ==1) ) {
3585  // Skip the STL container the first time around
3586  // Skip the regular classes the second time around;
3587  info->BuildCheck(this);
3588  Int_t uid = info->GetNumber();
3589  Int_t asize = fClassIndex->GetSize();
3590  if (uid >= asize && uid <100000) fClassIndex->Set(2*asize);
3591  if (uid >= 0 && uid < fClassIndex->GetSize()) fClassIndex->fArray[uid] = 1;
3592  else {
3593  printf("ReadStreamerInfo, class:%s, illegal uid=%d\n",info->GetName(),uid);
3594  }
3595  if (gDebug > 0) printf(" -class: %s version: %d info read at slot %d\n",info->GetName(), info->GetClassVersion(),uid);
3596  }
3597  lnk = lnk->Next();
3598  }
3599  }
3600  fClassIndex->fArray[0] = 0;
3601  list->Clear(); //this will delete all TStreamerInfo objects with kCanDelete bit set
3602  delete list;
3603 
3604 #ifdef R__USE_IMT
3605  // We are done processing the record, let future calls and other threads that it
3606  // has been done.
3607  fgTsSIHashes.Insert(listRetcode.fHash);
3608 #endif
3609 }

3611 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
3612 /// Specify if the streamerinfos must be read at file opening.
3613 ///
3614 /// If fgReadInfo is true (default) TFile::ReadStreamerInfo is called
3615 /// when opening the file.
3616 /// It may be interesting to set fgReadInfo to false to speedup the file
3617 /// opening time or in case libraries containing classes referenced
3618 /// by the file have not yet been loaded.
3619 /// if fgReadInfo is false, one can still read the StreamerInfo with
3620 /// myfile.ReadStreamerInfo();
3621 
3622 void TFile::SetReadStreamerInfo(Bool_t readinfo)
3623 {
3624  fgReadInfo = readinfo;
3625 }
3626 
3627 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
3628 /// If the streamerinfos are to be read at file opening.
3629 ///
3630 /// See TFile::SetReadStreamerInfo for more documentation.
3631 
3632 Bool_t TFile::GetReadStreamerInfo()
3633 {
3634  return fgReadInfo;
3635 }
3636 
3637 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
3638 /// Show the StreamerInfo of all classes written to this file.
3639 
3640 void TFile::ShowStreamerInfo()
3641 {
3642  TList *list = GetStreamerInfoList();
3643  if (!list) return;
3644 
3645  list->ls();
3646  delete list;
3647 }

3649 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
3650 /// Check if the ProcessID pidd is already in the file,
3651 /// if not, add it and return the index number in the local file list.
3652 
3653 UShort_t TFile::WriteProcessID(TProcessID *pidd)
3654 {
3655  TProcessID *pid = pidd;
3656  if (!pid) pid = TProcessID::GetPID();
3657  TObjArray *pids = GetListOfProcessIDs();
3658  Int_t npids = GetNProcessIDs();
3659  for (Int_t i=0;i<npids;i++) {
3660  if (pids->At(i) == pid) return (UShort_t)i;
3661  }
3662 
3663  this->SetBit(TFile::kHasReferences);
3664  pids->AddAtAndExpand(pid,npids);
3665  pid->IncrementCount();
3666  char name[32];
3667  snprintf(name,32,"ProcessID%d",npids);
3668  this->WriteTObject(pid,name);
3669  this->IncrementProcessIDs();
3670  if (gDebug > 0) {
3671  Info("WriteProcessID", "name=%s, file=%s", name, GetName());
3672  }
3673  return (UShort_t)npids;
3674 }

3677 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
3678 /// Write the list of TStreamerInfo as a single object in this file
3679 /// The class Streamer description for all classes written to this file
3680 /// is saved. See class TStreamerInfo.
3681 
3682 void TFile::WriteStreamerInfo()
3683 {
3684  //if (!gFile) return;
3685  if (!fWritable) return;
3686  if (!fClassIndex) return;
3687  if (fIsPcmFile) return; // No schema evolution for ROOT PCM files.
3688  if (fClassIndex->fArray[0] == 0
3689  && fSeekInfo != 0) {
3690  // No need to update the index if no new classes added to the file
3691  // but write once an empty StreamerInfo list to mark that there is no need
3692  // for StreamerInfos in this file.
3693  return;
3694  }
3695  if (gDebug > 0) Info("WriteStreamerInfo", "called for file %s",GetName());
3696 
3697  SafeDelete(fInfoCache);
3698 
3699  // build a temporary list with the marked files
3700  TIter next(gROOT->GetListOfStreamerInfo());
3701  TStreamerInfo *info;
3702  TList list;
3703  TList listOfRules;
3704  listOfRules.SetOwner(kTRUE);
3705  listOfRules.SetName("listOfRules");
3706  std::set<TClass*> classSet;
3707 
3708 
3709  while ((info = (TStreamerInfo*)next())) {
3710  Int_t uid = info->GetNumber();
3711  if (fClassIndex->fArray[uid]) {
3712  list.Add(info);
3713  if (gDebug > 0) printf(" -class: %s info number %d saved\n",info->GetName(),uid);
3714 
3715  // Add the IO customization rules to the list to be saved for the underlying
3716  // class but make sure to add them only once.
3717  TClass *clinfo = info->GetClass();
3718  if (clinfo && clinfo->GetSchemaRules()) {
3719  if ( classSet.find( clinfo ) == classSet.end() ) {
3720  if (gDebug > 0) printf(" -class: %s stored the I/O customization rules\n",info->GetName());
3721 
3722  TObjArrayIter it( clinfo->GetSchemaRules()->GetRules() );
3723  ROOT::TSchemaRule *rule;
3724  while( (rule = (ROOT::TSchemaRule*)it.Next()) ) {
3725  TObjString *obj = new TObjString();
3726  rule->AsString(obj->String());
3727  listOfRules.Add(obj);
3728  }
3729  classSet.insert(clinfo);
3730  }
3731  }
3732  }
3733  }
3734 
3735  // Write the StreamerInfo list even if it is empty.
3736  fClassIndex->fArray[0] = 2; //to prevent adding classes in TStreamerInfo::TagFile
3737 
3738  if (listOfRules.GetEntries()) {
3739  // Only add the list of rules if we have something to say.
3740  list.Add(&listOfRules);
3741  }
3742 
3743  //free previous StreamerInfo record
3744  if (fSeekInfo) MakeFree(fSeekInfo,fSeekInfo+fNbytesInfo-1);
3745  //Create new key
3746  TKey key(&list,"StreamerInfo",GetBestBuffer(), this);
3747  fKeys->Remove(&key);
3748  fSeekInfo = key.GetSeekKey();
3749  fNbytesInfo = key.GetNbytes();
3750  SumBuffer(key.GetObjlen());
3751  key.WriteFile(0);
3752 
3753  fClassIndex->fArray[0] = 0;
3754 
3755  list.RemoveLast(); // remove the listOfRules.
3756 }

3758 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
3759 /// Open a file for reading through the file cache.
3760 ///
3761 /// The file will be downloaded to the cache and opened from there.
3762 /// If the download fails, it will be opened remotely.
3763 /// The file will be downloaded to the directory specified by SetCacheFileDir().
3764 
3765 TFile *TFile::OpenFromCache(const char *name, Option_t *, const char *ftitle,
3766  Int_t compress, Int_t netopt)
3767 {
3768  TFile *f = 0;
3769 
3770  if (fgCacheFileDir == "") {
3771  ::Warning("TFile::OpenFromCache",
3772  "you want to read through a cache, but you have no valid cache "
3773  "directory set - reading remotely");
3774  ::Info("TFile::OpenFromCache", "set cache directory using TFile::SetCacheFileDir()");
3775  } else {
3776  TUrl fileurl(name);
3777  TUrl tagurl;
3778 
3779  if ((!strcmp(fileurl.GetProtocol(), "file"))) {
3780  // it makes no sense to read local files through a file cache
3781  if (!fgCacheFileForce)
3782  ::Warning("TFile::OpenFromCache",
3783  "you want to read through a cache, but you are reading "
3784  "local files - CACHEREAD disabled");
3785  } else {
3786  // this is a remote file and worthwhile to be put into the local cache
3787  // now create cachepath to put it
3788  TString cachefilepath;
3789  TString cachefilepathbasedir;
3790  cachefilepath = fgCacheFileDir;
3791  cachefilepath += fileurl.GetFile();
3792  cachefilepathbasedir = gSystem->DirName(cachefilepath);
3793  if ((gSystem->mkdir(cachefilepathbasedir, kTRUE) < 0) &&
3794  (gSystem->AccessPathName(cachefilepathbasedir, kFileExists))) {
3795  ::Warning("TFile::OpenFromCache","you want to read through a cache, but I "
3796  "cannot create the directory %s - CACHEREAD disabled",
3797  cachefilepathbasedir.Data());
3798  } else {
3799  // check if this should be a zip file
3800  if (strlen(fileurl.GetAnchor())) {
3801  // remove the anchor and change the target name
3802  cachefilepath += "__";
3803  cachefilepath += fileurl.GetAnchor();
3804  fileurl.SetAnchor("");
3805  }
3806  if (strstr(name,"zip=")) {
3807  // filter out this option and change the target cache name
3808  TString urloptions = fileurl.GetOptions();
3809  TString newoptions;
3810  TObjArray *objOptions = urloptions.Tokenize("&");
3811  Int_t optioncount = 0;
3812  TString zipname;
3813  for (Int_t n = 0; n < objOptions->GetEntries(); n++) {
3814  TString loption = ((TObjString*)objOptions->At(n))->GetName();
3815  TObjArray *objTags = loption.Tokenize("=");
3816  if (objTags->GetEntries() == 2) {
3817  TString key = ((TObjString*)objTags->At(0))->GetName();
3818  TString value = ((TObjString*)objTags->At(1))->GetName();
3819  if (key.CompareTo("zip", TString::kIgnoreCase)) {
3820  if (optioncount!=0) {
3821  newoptions += "&";
3822  }
3823  newoptions += key;
3824  newoptions += "=";
3825  newoptions += value;
3826  ++optioncount;
3827  } else {
3828  zipname = value;
3829  }
3830  }
3831  delete objTags;
3832  }
3833  delete objOptions;
3834  fileurl.SetOptions(newoptions.Data());
3835  cachefilepath += "__";
3836  cachefilepath += zipname;
3837  fileurl.SetAnchor("");
3838  }
3839 
3840  Bool_t need2copy = kFALSE;
3841 
3842  // check if file is in the cache
3843  Long_t id;
3844  Long64_t size;
3845  Long_t flags;
3846  Long_t modtime;
3847  if (!gSystem->GetPathInfo(cachefilepath, &id, &size, &flags, &modtime)) {
3848  // file is in the cache
3849  if (!fgCacheFileDisconnected) {
3850  char cacheblock[256];
3851  char remotblock[256];
3852  // check the remote file for it's size and compare some magic bytes
3853  TString cfurl;
3854  cfurl = cachefilepath;
3855  cfurl += "?filetype=raw";
3856  TUrl rurl(name);
3857  TString ropt = rurl.GetOptions();
3858  ropt += "&filetype=raw";
3859  rurl.SetOptions(ropt);
3860 
3861  Bool_t forcedcache = fgCacheFileForce;
3862  fgCacheFileForce = kFALSE;
3863 
3864  TFile *cachefile = TFile::Open(cfurl, "READ");
3865  TFile *remotfile = TFile::Open(rurl.GetUrl(), "READ");
3866 
3867  fgCacheFileForce = forcedcache;
3868 
3869  if (!cachefile) {
3870  need2copy = kTRUE;
3871  ::Error("TFile::OpenFromCache",
3872  "cannot open the cache file to check cache consistency");
3873  return 0;
3874  }
3875 
3876  if (!remotfile) {
3877  ::Error("TFile::OpenFromCache",
3878  "cannot open the remote file to check cache consistency");
3879  return 0;
3880  }
3881 
3882  cachefile->Seek(0);
3883  remotfile->Seek(0);
3884 
3885  if ((!cachefile->ReadBuffer(cacheblock,256)) &&
3886  (!remotfile->ReadBuffer(remotblock,256))) {
3887  if (memcmp(cacheblock, remotblock, 256)) {
3888  ::Warning("TFile::OpenFromCache", "the header of the cache file "
3889  "differs from the remote file - forcing an update");
3890  need2copy = kTRUE;
3891  }
3892  } else {
3893  ::Warning("TFile::OpenFromCache", "the header of the cache and/or "
3894  "remote file are not readable - forcing an update");
3895  need2copy = kTRUE;
3896  }
3897 
3898  delete remotfile;
3899  delete cachefile;
3900  }
3901  } else {
3902  need2copy = kTRUE;
3903  }
3904 
3905  // try to fetch the file (disable now the forced caching)
3906  Bool_t forcedcache = fgCacheFileForce;
3907  fgCacheFileForce = kFALSE;
3908  if (need2copy && !TFile::Cp(name, cachefilepath)) {
3909  ::Warning("TFile::OpenFromCache", "you want to read through a cache, but I "
3910  "cannot make a cache copy of %s - CACHEREAD disabled",
3911  cachefilepathbasedir.Data());
3912  fgCacheFileForce = forcedcache;
3913  if (fgOpenTimeout != 0)
3914  return 0;
3915  } else {
3916  fgCacheFileForce = forcedcache;
3917  ::Info("TFile::OpenFromCache", "using local cache copy of %s [%s]",
3918  name, cachefilepath.Data());
3919  // finally we have the file and can open it locally
3920  fileurl.SetProtocol("file");
3921  fileurl.SetFile(cachefilepath);
3922 
3923  tagurl = fileurl;
3924  TString tagfile;
3925  tagfile = cachefilepath;
3926  tagfile += ".ROOT.cachefile";
3927  tagurl.SetFile(tagfile);
3928  // we symlink this file as a ROOT cached file
3929  gSystem->Symlink(gSystem->BaseName(cachefilepath), tagfile);
3930  return TFile::Open(fileurl.GetUrl(), "READ", ftitle, compress, netopt);
3931  }
3932  }
3933  }
3934  }
3935 
3936  // Failed
3937  return f;
3938 }
3939 
3940 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
3941 /// Create / open a file
3942 ///
3943 /// The type of the file can be either a
3944 /// TFile, TNetFile, TWebFile or any TFile derived class for which an
3945 /// plugin library handler has been registered with the plugin manager
3946 /// (for the plugin manager see the TPluginManager class). The returned
3947 /// type of TFile depends on the file name specified by 'url'.
3948 /// If 'url' is a '|'-separated list of file URLs, the 'URLs' are tried
3949 /// sequentially in the specified order until a successful open.
3950 /// If the file starts with "root:", "roots:" or "rootk:" a TNetFile object
3951 /// will be returned, with "http:" a TWebFile, with "file:" a local TFile,
3952 /// etc. (see the list of TFile plugin handlers in $ROOTSYS/etc/system.rootrc
3953 /// for regular expressions that will be checked) and as last a local file will
3954 /// be tried.
3955 /// Before opening a file via TNetFile a check is made to see if the URL
3956 /// specifies a local file. If that is the case the file will be opened
3957 /// via a normal TFile. To force the opening of a local file via a
3958 /// TNetFile use either TNetFile directly or specify as host "localhost".
3959 /// The netopt argument is only used by TNetFile. For the meaning of the
3960 /// options and other arguments see the constructors of the individual
3961 /// file classes. In case of error returns 0.
3962 ///
3963 /// For TFile implementations supporting asynchronous file open, see
3964 /// TFile::AsyncOpen(...), it is possible to request a timeout with the
3965 /// option <b>TIMEOUT=<secs></b>: the timeout must be specified in seconds and
3966 /// it will be internally checked with granularity of one millisec.
3967 /// For remote files there is the option: <b>CACHEREAD</b> opens an existing
3968 /// file for reading through the file cache. The file will be downloaded to
3969 /// the cache and opened from there. If the download fails, it will be opened remotely.
3970 /// The file will be downloaded to the directory specified by SetCacheFileDir().
3971 ///
3972 /// *The caller is responsible for deleting the pointer.*
3973 
3974 TFile *TFile::Open(const char *url, Option_t *options, const char *ftitle,
3975  Int_t compress, Int_t netopt)
3976 {
3977  TPluginHandler *h;
3978  TFile *f = 0;
3979  EFileType type = kFile;
3980 
3981  // Check input
3982  if (!url || strlen(url) <= 0) {
3983  ::Error("TFile::Open", "no url specified");
3984  return f;
3985  }
3986 
3987  TString expandedUrl(url);
3988  gSystem->ExpandPathName(expandedUrl);
3989 
3990  // If a timeout has been specified extract the value and try to apply it (it requires
3991  // support for asynchronous open, though; the following is completely transparent if
3992  // such support if not available for the required protocol)
3993  TString opts(options);
3994  Int_t ito = opts.Index("TIMEOUT=");
3995  if (ito != kNPOS) {
3996  TString sto = opts(ito + strlen("TIMEOUT="), opts.Length());
3997  while (!(sto.IsDigit()) && !(sto.IsNull())) { sto.Remove(sto.Length()-1,1); }
3998  if (!(sto.IsNull())) {
3999  // Timeout in millisecs
4000  Int_t toms = sto.Atoi() * 1000;
4001  if (gDebug > 0) ::Info("TFile::Open", "timeout of %d millisec requested", toms);
4002  // Remove from the options field
4003  sto.Insert(0, "TIMEOUT=");
4004  opts.ReplaceAll(sto, "");
4005  // Asynchrounous open
4006  TFileOpenHandle *fh = TFile::AsyncOpen(expandedUrl, opts, ftitle, compress, netopt);
4007  // Check the result in steps of 1 millisec
4008  TFile::EAsyncOpenStatus aos = TFile::kAOSNotAsync;
4009  aos = TFile::GetAsyncOpenStatus(fh);
4010  Int_t xtms = toms;
4011  while (aos != TFile::kAOSNotAsync && aos == TFile::kAOSInProgress && xtms > 0) {
4012  gSystem->Sleep(1);
4013  xtms -= 1;
4014  aos = TFile::GetAsyncOpenStatus(fh);
4015  }
4016  if (aos == TFile::kAOSNotAsync || aos == TFile::kAOSSuccess) {
4017  // Do open the file now
4018  f = TFile::Open(fh);
4019  if (gDebug > 0) {
4020  if (aos == TFile::kAOSSuccess)
4021  ::Info("TFile::Open", "waited %d millisec for asynchronous open", toms - xtms);
4022  else
4023  ::Info("TFile::Open", "timeout option not supported (requires asynchronous"
4024  " open support)");
4025  }
4026  } else {
4027  if (xtms <= 0)
4028  ::Error("TFile::Open", "timeout expired while opening '%s'", expandedUrl.Data());
4029  // Cleanup the request
4030  SafeDelete(fh);
4031  }
4032  // Done
4033  return f;
4034  } else {
4035  ::Warning("TFile::Open", "incomplete 'TIMEOUT=' option specification - ignored");
4036  opts.ReplaceAll("TIMEOUT=", "");
4037  }
4038  }
4039 
4040  // We will use this from now on
4041  const char *option = opts;
4042 
4043  // Many URLs? Redirect output and print errors in case of global failure
4044  TString namelist(expandedUrl);
4045  Ssiz_t ip = namelist.Index("|");
4046  Bool_t rediroutput = (ip != kNPOS &&
4047  ip != namelist.Length()-1 && gDebug <= 0) ? kTRUE : kFALSE;
4048  RedirectHandle_t rh;
4049  if (rediroutput) {
4050  TString outf = ".TFileOpen_";
4051  FILE *fout = gSystem->TempFileName(outf);
4052  if (fout) {
4053  fclose(fout);
4054  gSystem->RedirectOutput(outf, "w", &rh);
4055  }
4056  }
4057 
4058  // Try sequentially all names in 'names'
4059  TString name, n;
4060  Ssiz_t from = 0;
4061  while (namelist.Tokenize(n, from, "|") && !f) {
4062 
4063  // check if we read through a file cache
4064  if (!strcasecmp(option, "CACHEREAD") ||
4065  ((!strcasecmp(option,"READ") || !option[0]) && fgCacheFileForce)) {
4066  // Try opening the file from the cache
4067  if ((f = TFile::OpenFromCache(n, option, ftitle, compress, netopt)))
4068  return f;
4069  }
4070 
4071  IncrementFileCounter();
4072 
4073  // change names to be recognized by the plugin manager
4074  // e.g. /protocol/path/to/file.root -> protocol:/path/to/file.root
4075  TUrl urlname(n, kTRUE);
4076  name = urlname.GetUrl();
4077  // Check first if a pending async open request matches this one
4078  if (fgAsyncOpenRequests && (fgAsyncOpenRequests->GetSize() > 0)) {
4079  TIter nxr(fgAsyncOpenRequests);
4080  TFileOpenHandle *fh = 0;
4081  while ((fh = (TFileOpenHandle *)nxr()))
4082  if (fh->Matches(name))
4083  return TFile::Open(fh);
4084  }
4085 
4086  TString urlOptions(urlname.GetOptions());
4087  if (urlOptions.BeginsWith("pmerge") || urlOptions.Contains("&pmerge") || urlOptions.Contains(" pmerge")) {
4088  type = kMerge;
4089 
4090  // Pass the full name including the url options:
4091  f = (TFile*) gROOT->ProcessLineFast(TString::Format("new TParallelMergingFile(\"%s\",\"%s\",\"%s\",%d)",n.Data(),option,ftitle,compress));
4092 
4093  } else {
4094  // Resolve the file type; this also adjusts names
4095  TString lfname = gEnv->GetValue("Path.Localroot", "");
4096  type = GetType(name, option, &lfname);
4097 
4098  if (type == kLocal) {
4099 
4100  // Local files
4101  if (lfname.IsNull()) {
4102  urlname.SetHost("");
4103  urlname.SetProtocol("file");
4104  lfname = urlname.GetUrl();
4105  }
4106  f = new TFile(lfname.Data(), option, ftitle, compress);
4107 
4108  } else if (type == kNet) {
4109 
4110  // Network files
4111  if ((h = gROOT->GetPluginManager()->FindHandler("TFile", name))) {
4112  if (h->LoadPlugin() == -1)
4113  return 0;
4114  f = (TFile*) h->ExecPlugin(5, name.Data(), option, ftitle, compress, netopt);
4115  }
4116 
4117  } else if (type == kWeb) {
4118 
4119  // Web files
4120  if ((h = gROOT->GetPluginManager()->FindHandler("TFile", name))) {
4121  if (h->LoadPlugin() == -1)
4122  return 0;
4123  f = (TFile*) h->ExecPlugin(2, name.Data(), option);
4124  }
4125 
4126  } else if (type == kFile) {
4127 
4128  // 'file:' protocol
4129  if ((h = gROOT->GetPluginManager()->FindHandler("TFile", name)) &&
4130  h->LoadPlugin() == 0) {
4131  name.ReplaceAll("file:", "");
4132  f = (TFile*) h->ExecPlugin(4, name.Data(), option, ftitle, compress);
4133  } else
4134  f = new TFile(name.Data(), option, ftitle, compress);
4135 
4136  } else {
4137 
4138  // no recognized specification: try the plugin manager
4139  if ((h = gROOT->GetPluginManager()->FindHandler("TFile", name.Data()))) {
4140  if (h->LoadPlugin() == -1)
4141  return 0;
4142  TClass *cl = TClass::GetClass(h->GetClass());
4143  if (cl && cl->InheritsFrom("TNetFile"))
4144  f = (TFile*) h->ExecPlugin(5, name.Data(), option, ftitle, compress, netopt);
4145  else
4146  f = (TFile*) h->ExecPlugin(4, name.Data(), option, ftitle, compress);
4147  } else {
4148  // Just try to open it locally but via TFile::Open, so that we pick-up the correct
4149  // plug-in in the case file name contains information about a special backend (e.g.
4150  f = TFile::Open(urlname.GetFileAndOptions(), option, ftitle, compress);
4151  }
4152  }
4153  }
4154 
4155  if (f && f->IsZombie()) {
4156  TString newUrl = f->GetNewUrl();
4157  delete f;
4158  if( newUrl.Length() && gEnv->GetValue("TFile.CrossProtocolRedirects", 1) )
4159  f = TFile::Open( newUrl, option, ftitle, compress );
4160  else
4161  f = 0;
4162  }
4163  }
4164 
4165  if (rediroutput) {
4166  // Restore output to stdout
4167  gSystem->RedirectOutput(0, "", &rh);
4168  // If we failed print error messages
4169  if (!f)
4170  gSystem->ShowOutput(&rh);
4171  // Remove the file
4172  gSystem->Unlink(rh.fFile);
4173  }
4174 
4175  // if the file is writable, non local, and not opened in raw mode
4176  // we create a default write cache of 512 KBytes
4177  if (type != kLocal && type != kFile &&
4178  f && f->IsWritable() && !f->IsRaw()) {
4179  new TFileCacheWrite(f, 1);
4180  }
4181 
4182  return f;
4183 }
4184 
4185 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
4186 /// Submit an asynchronous open request.
4187 
4188 /// See TFile::Open(const char *, ...) for an
4189 /// explanation of the arguments. A handler is returned which is to be passed
4190 /// to TFile::Open(TFileOpenHandle *) to get the real TFile instance once
4191 /// the file is open.
4192 /// This call never blocks and it is provided to allow parallel submission
4193 /// of file opening operations expected to take a long time.
4194 /// TFile::Open(TFileOpenHandle *) may block if the file is not yet ready.
4195 /// The sequence
4196 ///
4197 /// TFile::Open(TFile::AsyncOpen(const char *, ...))
4198 ///
4199 /// is equivalent to
4200 ///
4201 /// TFile::Open(const char *, ...)
4202 ///
4203 /// To be effective, the underlying TFile implementation must be able to
4204 /// support asynchronous open functionality. Currently, only TXNetFile
4205 /// supports it. If the functionality is not implemented, this call acts
4206 /// transparently by returning an handle with the arguments for the
4207 /// standard synchronous open run by TFile::Open(TFileOpenHandle *).
4208 /// The retuned handle will be adopted by TFile after opening completion
4209 /// in TFile::Open(TFileOpenHandle *); if opening is not finalized the
4210 /// handle must be deleted by the caller.
4211 
4212 TFileOpenHandle *TFile::AsyncOpen(const char *url, Option_t *option,
4213  const char *ftitle, Int_t compress,
4214  Int_t netopt)
4215 {
4216  TFileOpenHandle *fh = 0;
4217  TPluginHandler *h;
4218  TFile *f = 0;
4219  Bool_t notfound = kTRUE;
4220 
4221  // Check input
4222  if (!url || strlen(url) <= 0) {
4223  ::Error("TFile::AsyncOpen", "no url specified");
4224  return fh;
4225  }
4226 
4227  // Many URLs? Redirect output and print errors in case of global failure
4228  TString namelist(url);
4229  gSystem->ExpandPathName(namelist);
4230  Ssiz_t ip = namelist.Index("|");
4231  Bool_t rediroutput = (ip != kNPOS &&
4232  ip != namelist.Length()-1 && gDebug <= 0) ? kTRUE : kFALSE;
4233  RedirectHandle_t rh;
4234  if (rediroutput) {
4235  TString outf = ".TFileAsyncOpen_";
4236  FILE *fout = gSystem->TempFileName(outf);
4237  if (fout) {
4238  fclose(fout);
4239  gSystem->RedirectOutput(outf, "w", &rh);
4240  }
4241  }
4242 
4243  // Try sequentially all names in 'names'
4244  TString name, n;
4245  Ssiz_t from = 0;
4246  while (namelist.Tokenize(n, from, "|") && !f) {
4247 
4248  // change names to be recognized by the plugin manager
4249  // e.g. /protocol/path/to/file.root -> protocol:/path/to/file.root
4250  TUrl urlname(n, kTRUE);
4251  name = urlname.GetUrl();
4252 
4253  // Resolve the file type; this also adjusts names
4254  EFileType type = GetType(name, option);
4255 
4256  // Here we send the asynchronous request if the functionality is implemented
4257  if (type == kNet) {
4258  // Network files
4259  if ((h = gROOT->GetPluginManager()->FindHandler("TFile", name)) &&
4260  (!strcmp(h->GetClass(),"TXNetFile") || !strcmp(h->GetClass(),"TNetXNGFile"))
4261  && h->LoadPlugin() == 0) {
4262  f = (TFile*) h->ExecPlugin(6, name.Data(), option, ftitle, compress, netopt, kTRUE);
4263  notfound = kFALSE;
4264  }
4265  }
4266  if ((h = gROOT->GetPluginManager()->FindHandler("TFile", name)) &&
4267  !strcmp(h->GetClass(),"TAlienFile") && h->LoadPlugin() == 0) {
4268  f = (TFile*) h->ExecPlugin(5, name.Data(), option, ftitle, compress, kTRUE);
4269  notfound = kFALSE;
4270  }
4271 
4272  }
4273 
4274  if (rediroutput) {
4275  // Restore output to stdout
4276  gSystem->RedirectOutput(0, "", &rh);
4277  // If we failed print error messages
4278  if (!notfound && !f)
4279  gSystem->ShowOutput(&rh);
4280  // Remove the file
4281  gSystem->Unlink(rh.fFile);
4282  }
4283 
4284  // Make sure that no error occurred
4285  if (notfound) {
4286  SafeDelete(f);
4287  // Save the arguments in the handler, so that a standard open can be
4288  // attempted later on
4289  fh = new TFileOpenHandle(name, option, ftitle, compress, netopt);
4290  } else if (f) {
4291  // Fill the opaque handler to be use to attach the file later on
4292  fh = new TFileOpenHandle(f);
4293  }
4294 
4295  // Record this request
4296  if (fh) {
4297  // Create the lst, if not done already
4298  if (!fgAsyncOpenRequests)
4299  fgAsyncOpenRequests = new TList;
4300  fgAsyncOpenRequests->Add(fh);
4301  }
4302 
4303  // We are done
4304  return fh;
4305 }
4306 
4307 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
4308 /// Waits for the completion of an asynchronous open request.
4309 ///
4310 /// Returns the pointer to the associated TFile, transferring ownership of the
4311 /// handle to the TFile instance.
4312 
4313 TFile *TFile::Open(TFileOpenHandle *fh)
4314 {
4315  TFile *f = 0;
4316 
4317  // Note that the request may have failed
4318  if (fh && fgAsyncOpenRequests) {
4319  // Remove it from the pending list: we need to do it at this level to avoid
4320  // recursive calls in the standard TFile::Open
4321  fgAsyncOpenRequests->Remove(fh);
4322  // Was asynchronous open functionality implemented?
4323  if ((f = fh->GetFile()) && !(f->IsZombie())) {
4324  // Yes: wait for the completion of the open phase, if needed
4325  Bool_t cr = (!strcmp(f->GetOption(),"CREATE") ||
4326  !strcmp(f->GetOption(),"RECREATE") ||
4327  !strcmp(f->GetOption(),"NEW")) ? kTRUE : kFALSE;
4328  f->Init(cr);
4329  } else {
4330  // No: process a standard open
4331  f = TFile::Open(fh->GetName(), fh->GetOpt(), fh->GetTitle(),
4332  fh->GetCompress(), fh->GetNetOpt());
4333  }
4334 
4335  // Adopt the handle instance in the TFile instance so that it gets
4336  // automatically cleaned up
4337  if (f) f->fAsyncHandle = fh;
4338  }
4339 
4340  // We are done
4341  return f;
4342 }

4488 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
4489 /// Sets the directory where to locally stage/cache remote files.
4490 /// If the directory is not writable by us return kFALSE.
4491 
4492 Bool_t TFile::SetCacheFileDir(std::string_view cachedir, Bool_t operatedisconnected,
4493  Bool_t forcecacheread )
4494 {
4495  TString cached = cachedir;
4496  if (!cached.EndsWith("/"))
4497  cached += "/";
4498 
4499  if (gSystem->AccessPathName(cached, kFileExists)) {
4500  // try to create it
4501  gSystem->mkdir(cached, kTRUE);
4502  if (gSystem->AccessPathName(cached, kFileExists)) {
4503  ::Error("TFile::SetCacheFileDir", "no sufficient permissions on cache directory %s or cannot create it", TString(cachedir).Data());
4504  fgCacheFileDir = "";
4505  return kFALSE;
4506  }
4507  gSystem->Chmod(cached, 0700);
4508  }
4509  if (gSystem->AccessPathName(cached, kWritePermission))
4510  gSystem->Chmod(cached, 0700);
4511  fgCacheFileDir = cached;
4512  fgCacheFileDisconnected = operatedisconnected;
4513  fgCacheFileForce = forcecacheread;
4514  return kTRUE;
4515 }

4524 
4525 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
4526 /// Try to shrink the cache to the desired size.
4527 ///
4528 /// With the clenupinterval you can specify the minimum amount of time after
4529 /// the previous cleanup before the cleanup operation is repeated in
4530 /// the cache directory
4531 
4532 Bool_t TFile::ShrinkCacheFileDir(Long64_t shrinksize, Long_t cleanupinterval)
4533 {
4534  if (fgCacheFileDir == "") {
4535  return kFALSE;
4536  }
4537 
4538  // check the last clean-up in the cache
4539  Long_t id;
4540  Long64_t size;
4541  Long_t flags;
4542  Long_t modtime;
4543 
4544  TString cachetagfile = fgCacheFileDir;
4545  cachetagfile += ".tag.ROOT.cache";
4546  if (!gSystem->GetPathInfo(cachetagfile, &id, &size, &flags, &modtime)) {
4547  // check the time passed since last cache cleanup
4548  Long_t lastcleanuptime = ((Long_t)time(0) - modtime);
4549  if (lastcleanuptime < cleanupinterval) {
4550  ::Info("TFile::ShrinkCacheFileDir", "clean-up is skipped - last cleanup %lu seconds ago - you requested %lu", lastcleanuptime, cleanupinterval);
4551  return kTRUE;
4552  }
4553  }
4554 
4555  // (re-)create the cache tag file
4556  cachetagfile += "?filetype=raw";
4557  TFile *tagfile = 0;
4558 
4559  if (!(tagfile = TFile::Open(cachetagfile, "RECREATE"))) {
4560  ::Error("TFile::ShrinkCacheFileDir", "cannot create the cache tag file %s", cachetagfile.Data());
4561  return kFALSE;
4562  }
4563 
4564  // the shortest garbage collector in the world - one long line of PERL - unlinks files only,
4565  // if there is a symbolic link with '.ROOT.cachefile' for safety ;-)
4566 
4567  TString cmd;
4568 #if defined(R__WIN32)
4569  cmd = "echo <TFile::ShrinkCacheFileDir>: cleanup to be implemented";
4570 #elif defined(R__MACOSX)
4571  cmd.Format("perl -e 'my $cachepath = \"%s\"; my $cachesize = %lld;my $findcommand=\"find $cachepath -type f -exec stat -f \\\"\\%%a::\\%%N::\\%%z\\\" \\{\\} \\\\\\;\";my $totalsize=0;open FIND, \"$findcommand | sort -k 1 |\";while (<FIND>) { my ($accesstime, $filename, $filesize) = split \"::\",$_; $totalsize += $filesize;if ($totalsize > $cachesize) {if ( ( -e \"${filename}.ROOT.cachefile\" ) && ( -e \"${filename}\" ) ) {unlink \"$filename.ROOT.cachefile\";unlink \"$filename\";}}}close FIND;' ", fgCacheFileDir.Data(),shrinksize);
4572 #else
4573  cmd.Format("perl -e 'my $cachepath = \"%s\"; my $cachesize = %lld;my $findcommand=\"find $cachepath -type f -exec stat -c \\\"\\%%x::\\%%n::\\%%s\\\" \\{\\} \\\\\\;\";my $totalsize=0;open FIND, \"$findcommand | sort -k 1 |\";while (<FIND>) { my ($accesstime, $filename, $filesize) = split \"::\",$_; $totalsize += $filesize;if ($totalsize > $cachesize) {if ( ( -e \"${filename}.ROOT.cachefile\" ) && ( -e \"${filename}\" ) ) {unlink \"$filename.ROOT.cachefile\";unlink \"$filename\";}}}close FIND;' ", fgCacheFileDir.Data(),shrinksize);
4574 #endif
4575 
4576  tagfile->WriteBuffer(cmd, 4096);
4577  delete tagfile;
4578 
4579  if ((gSystem->Exec(cmd)) != 0) {
4580  ::Error("TFile::ShrinkCacheFileDir", "error executing clean-up script");
4581  return kFALSE;
4582  }
4583 
4584  return kTRUE;
4585 }

4625 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
4626 /// Return kTRUE if 'url' matches the coordinates of this file.
4627 ///
4628 /// The check is implementation dependent and may need to be overload
4629 /// by each TFile implementation relying on this check.
4630 /// The default implementation checks the file name only.
4631 
4632 Bool_t TFile::Matches(const char *url)
4633 {
4634  // Check the full URL, including port and FQDN.
4635  TUrl u(url);
4636 
4637  // Check
4638  if (!strcmp(u.GetFile(), fUrl.GetFile())) {
4639  // Check ports
4640  if (u.GetPort() == fUrl.GetPort()) {
4641  if (!strcmp(u.GetHostFQDN(), fUrl.GetHostFQDN())) {
4642  // Ok, coordinates match
4643  return kTRUE;
4644  }
4645  }
4646  }
4647 
4648  // Default is not matching
4649  return kFALSE;
4650 }
4651 
4652 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
4653 /// Return kTRUE if this async request matches the open request
4654 /// specified by 'url'
4655 
4656 Bool_t TFileOpenHandle::Matches(const char *url)
4657 {
4658  if (fFile) {
4659  return fFile->Matches(url);
4660  } else if (fName.Length() > 0){
4661  // Deep check of URLs
4662  TUrl u(url);
4663  TUrl uref(fName);
4664  if (!strcmp(u.GetFile(), uref.GetFile())) {
4665  // Check ports
4666  if (u.GetPort() == uref.GetPort()) {
4667  // Check also the host name
4668  if (!strcmp(u.GetHostFQDN(), uref.GetHostFQDN())) {
4669  // Ok, coordinates match
4670  return kTRUE;
4671  }
4672  }
4673  }
4674  }
4675 
4676  // Default is not matching
4677  return kFALSE;
4678 }
4679 
4680 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
4681 /// Resolve the file type as a function of the protocol field in 'name'
4682 ///
4683 /// If defined, the string 'prefix' is added when testing the locality of
4684 /// a 'name' with network-like structure (i.e. root://host//path); if the file
4685 /// is local, on return 'prefix' will contain the actual local path of the file.
4686 
4687 TFile::EFileType TFile::GetType(const char *name, Option_t *option, TString *prefix)
4688 {
4689  EFileType type = kDefault;
4690 
4691  TPMERegexp re("^(root|xroot).*", "i");
4692  if (re.Match(name)) {
4693  //
4694  // Should be a network file ...
4695  type = kNet;
4696  // ... but make sure that is not local or that a remote-like connection
4697  // is forced. Treat it as local if:
4698  // i) the url points to the localhost, the file will be opened in
4699  // readonly mode and the current user has read access;
4700  // ii) the specified user is equal to the current user then open local
4701  // TFile.
4702  Bool_t localFile = kFALSE;
4703  TUrl url(name);
4704  //
4705  // Check whether we should try to optimize for local files
4706  Bool_t forceRemote = gEnv->GetValue("Path.ForceRemote", 0);
4707  forceRemote = (forceRemote) ? kTRUE : gEnv->GetValue("TFile.ForceRemote", 0);
4708  TString opts = url.GetOptions();
4709  if (opts.Contains("remote=1"))
4710  forceRemote = kTRUE;
4711  else if (opts.Contains("remote=0"))
4712  forceRemote = kFALSE;
4713  if (!forceRemote) {
4714  // Generic locality test
4715  localFile = gSystem->IsPathLocal(name);
4716  if (localFile) {
4717  // Local path including the prefix
4718  const char *fname = url.GetFileAndOptions();
4719  TString lfname;
4720  if (fname[0] == '/') {
4721  if (prefix)
4722  lfname.Form("%s%s", prefix->Data(), fname);
4723  else
4724  lfname = fname;
4725  } else if (fname[0] == '~' || fname[0] == '$') {
4726  lfname = fname;
4727  } else {
4728  lfname.Form("%s/%s", gSystem->HomeDirectory(), fname);
4729  }
4730  // If option "READ" test existence and access
4731  TString opt = option;
4732  Bool_t read = (opt.IsNull() ||
4733  !opt.CompareTo("READ", TString::kIgnoreCase)) ? kTRUE : kFALSE;
4734  if (read) {
4735  char *fn;
4736  if ((fn = gSystem->ExpandPathName(TUrl(lfname).GetFile()))) {
4737  if (gSystem->AccessPathName(fn, kReadPermission))
4738  localFile = kFALSE;
4739  delete [] fn;
4740  }
4741  }
4742  // Return full local path if requested (and if the case)
4743  if (localFile && prefix)
4744  *prefix = lfname;
4745  }
4746  }
4747  //
4748  // Adjust the type according to findings
4749  type = (localFile) ? kLocal : type;
4750  } else if (TPMERegexp("^(http[s]?|s3http[s]?|[a]?s3|gs|gshttp[s]?){1}:", "i").Match(name)) {
4751  //
4752  // Web file
4753  type = kWeb;
4754  } else if (!strncmp(name, "file:", 5)) {
4755  //
4756  // 'file' protocol
4757  type = kFile;
4758  }
4759  // We are done
4760  return type;
4761 }
4762 
4763 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
4764 /// Get status of the async open request related to 'name'.
4765 
4766 TFile::EAsyncOpenStatus TFile::GetAsyncOpenStatus(const char* name)
4767 {
4768  // Check the list of pending async open requests
4769  if (fgAsyncOpenRequests && (fgAsyncOpenRequests->GetSize() > 0)) {
4770  TIter nxr(fgAsyncOpenRequests);
4771  TFileOpenHandle *fh = 0;
4772  while ((fh = (TFileOpenHandle *)nxr()))
4773  if (fh->Matches(name))
4774  return TFile::GetAsyncOpenStatus(fh);
4775  }
4776 
4777  // Check also the list of files open
4778  R__LOCKGUARD(gROOTMutex);
4779  TSeqCollection *of = gROOT->GetListOfFiles();
4780  if (of && (of->GetSize() > 0)) {
4781  TIter nxf(of);
4782  TFile *f = 0;
4783  while ((f = (TFile *)nxf()))
4784  if (f->Matches(name))
4785  return f->GetAsyncOpenStatus();
4786  }
4787 
4788  // Default is synchronous mode
4789  return kAOSNotAsync;
4790 }
4791 
4792 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
4793 /// Get status of the async open request related to 'handle'.
4794 
4795 TFile::EAsyncOpenStatus TFile::GetAsyncOpenStatus(TFileOpenHandle *handle)
4796 {
4797  if (handle && handle->fFile) {
4798  if (!handle->fFile->IsZombie())
4799  return handle->fFile->GetAsyncOpenStatus();
4800  else
4801  return TFile::kAOSFailure;
4802  }
4803 
4804  // Default is synchronous mode
4805  return TFile::kAOSNotAsync;
4806 }
4807 
4808 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
4809 /// Get final URL for file being opened asynchronously.
4810 /// Returns 0 is the information is not yet available.
4811 
4812 const TUrl *TFile::GetEndpointUrl(const char* name)
4813 {
4814  // Check the list of pending async open requests
4815  if (fgAsyncOpenRequests && (fgAsyncOpenRequests->GetSize() > 0)) {
4816  TIter nxr(fgAsyncOpenRequests);
4817  TFileOpenHandle *fh = 0;
4818  while ((fh = (TFileOpenHandle *)nxr()))
4819  if (fh->Matches(name))
4820  if (fh->fFile)
4821  return fh->fFile->GetEndpointUrl();
4822  }
4823 
4824  // Check also the list of files open
4825  R__LOCKGUARD(gROOTMutex);
4826  TSeqCollection *of = gROOT->GetListOfFiles();
4827  if (of && (of->GetSize() > 0)) {
4828  TIter nxf(of);
4829  TFile *f = 0;
4830  while ((f = (TFile *)nxf()))
4831  if (f->Matches(name))
4832  return f->GetEndpointUrl();
4833  }
4834 
4835  // Information not yet available
4836  return (const TUrl *)0;
4837 }

4839 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
4840 /// Print file copy progress.
4841 
4842 void TFile::CpProgress(Long64_t bytesread, Long64_t size, TStopwatch &watch)
4843 {
4844  fprintf(stderr, "[TFile::Cp] Total %.02f MB\t|", (Double_t)size/1048576);
4845 
4846  for (int l = 0; l < 20; l++) {
4847  if (size > 0) {
4848  if (l < 20*bytesread/size)
4849  fprintf(stderr, "=");
4850  else if (l == 20*bytesread/size)
4851  fprintf(stderr, ">");
4852  else if (l > 20*bytesread/size)
4853  fprintf(stderr, ".");
4854  } else
4855  fprintf(stderr, "=");
4856  }
4857  // Allow to update the GUI while uploading files
4858  gSystem->ProcessEvents();
4859  watch.Stop();
4860  Double_t lCopy_time = watch.RealTime();
4861  fprintf(stderr, "| %.02f %% [%.01f MB/s]\r",
4862  100.0*(size?(bytesread/((float)size)):1), (lCopy_time>0.)?bytesread/lCopy_time/1048576.:0.);
4863  watch.Continue();
4864 }
4865 
4866 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
4867 /// Allows to copy this file to the dst URL. Returns kTRUE in case of success,
4868 /// kFALSE otherwise.
4869 
4870 Bool_t TFile::Cp(const char *dst, Bool_t progressbar, UInt_t buffersize)
4871 {
4872  Bool_t rmdestiferror = kFALSE;
4873  TStopwatch watch;
4874  Bool_t success = kFALSE;
4875 
4876  TUrl dURL(dst, kTRUE);
4877 
4878  TString oopt = "RECREATE";
4879  TString ourl = dURL.GetUrl();
4880 
4881  // Files will be open in RAW mode
4882  TString raw = "filetype=raw";
4883 
4884  // Set optimization options for the destination file
4885  TString opt = dURL.GetOptions();
4886  if (opt != "") opt += "&";
4887  opt += raw;
4888 
4889  // AliEn files need to know where the source file is
4890  if (!strcmp(dURL.GetProtocol(), "alien"))
4891  opt += TString::Format("&source=%s", GetName());
4892 
4893  dURL.SetOptions(opt);
4894 
4895  char *copybuffer = 0;
4896 
4897  TFile *sfile = this;
4898  TFile *dfile = 0;
4899 
4900  // "RECREATE" does not work always well with XROOTD
4901  // namely when some pieces of the path are missing;
4902  // we force "NEW" in such a case
4903  if (TFile::GetType(ourl, "") == TFile::kNet) {
4904  if (gSystem->AccessPathName(ourl)) {
4905  oopt = "NEW";
4906  // Force creation of the missing parts of the path
4907  opt += "&mkpath=1";
4908  dURL.SetOptions(opt);
4909  }
4910  }
4911 
4912  // Open destination file
4913  if (!(dfile = TFile::Open(dURL.GetUrl(), oopt))) {
4914  ::Error("TFile::Cp", "cannot open destination file %s", dst);
4915  goto copyout;
4916  }
4917 
4918  // Probably we created a new file
4919  // We have to remove it in case of errors
4920  rmdestiferror = kTRUE;
4921 
4922  sfile->Seek(0);
4923  dfile->Seek(0);
4924 
4925  copybuffer = new char[buffersize];
4926  if (!copybuffer) {
4927  ::Error("TFile::Cp", "cannot allocate the copy buffer");
4928  goto copyout;
4929  }
4930 
4931  Bool_t readop;
4932  Bool_t writeop;
4933  Long64_t read;
4934  Long64_t written;
4935  Long64_t totalread;
4936  Long64_t filesize;
4937  Long64_t b00;
4938  filesize = sfile->GetSize();
4939  totalread = 0;
4940  watch.Start();
4941 
4942  b00 = sfile->GetBytesRead();
4943 
4944  do {
4945  if (progressbar) CpProgress(totalread, filesize,watch);
4946 
4947  Long64_t b1 = sfile->GetBytesRead() - b00;
4948 
4949  Long64_t readsize;
4950  if (filesize - b1 > (Long64_t)buffersize) {
4951  readsize = buffersize;
4952  } else {
4953  readsize = filesize - b1;
4954  }
4955 
4956  if (readsize == 0) break;
4957 
4958  Long64_t b0 = sfile->GetBytesRead();
4959  sfile->Seek(totalread,TFile::kBeg);
4960  readop = sfile->ReadBuffer(copybuffer, (Int_t)readsize);
4961  read = sfile->GetBytesRead() - b0;
4962  if ((read <= 0) || readop) {
4963  ::Error("TFile::Cp", "cannot read from source file %s. readsize=%lld read=%lld readop=%d",
4964  sfile->GetName(), readsize, read, readop);
4965  goto copyout;
4966  }
4967 
4968  Long64_t w0 = dfile->GetBytesWritten();
4969  writeop = dfile->WriteBuffer(copybuffer, (Int_t)read);
4970  written = dfile->GetBytesWritten() - w0;
4971  if ((written != read) || writeop) {
4972  ::Error("TFile::Cp", "cannot write %lld bytes to destination file %s", read, dst);
4973  goto copyout;
4974  }
4975  totalread += read;
4976  } while (read == (Long64_t)buffersize);
4977 
4978  if (progressbar) {
4979  CpProgress(totalread, filesize,watch);
4980  fprintf(stderr, "\n");
4981  }
4982 
4983  success = kTRUE;
4984 
4985 copyout:
4986  if (dfile) dfile->Close();
4987 
4988  if (dfile) delete dfile;
4989  if (copybuffer) delete[] copybuffer;
4990 
4991  if (rmdestiferror && (success != kTRUE))
4992  gSystem->Unlink(dst);
4993 
4994  watch.Stop();
4995  watch.Reset();
4996 
4997  return success;
4998 }
4999 
5000 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
5001 /// Allows to copy file from src to dst URL. Returns kTRUE in case of success,
5002 /// kFALSE otherwise.
5003 
5004 Bool_t TFile::Cp(const char *src, const char *dst, Bool_t progressbar,
5005  UInt_t buffersize)
5006 {
5007  TUrl sURL(src, kTRUE);
5008 
5009  // Files will be open in RAW mode
5010  TString raw = "filetype=raw";
5011 
5012  // Set optimization options for the source file
5013  TString opt = sURL.GetOptions();
5014  if (opt != "") opt += "&";
5015  opt += raw;
5016  // Netx-related options:
5017  // cachesz = 4*buffersize -> 4 buffers as peak mem usage
5018  // readaheadsz = 2*buffersize -> Keep at max 4*buffersize bytes outstanding when reading
5019  // rmpolicy = 1 -> Remove from the cache the blk with the least offset
5020  opt += TString::Format("&cachesz=%d&readaheadsz=%d&rmpolicy=1", 4*buffersize, 2*buffersize);
5021  sURL.SetOptions(opt);
5022 
5023  TFile *sfile = 0;
5024 
5025  Bool_t success = kFALSE;
5026 
5027  // Open source file
5028  if (!(sfile = TFile::Open(sURL.GetUrl(), "READ"))) {
5029  ::Error("TFile::Cp", "cannot open source file %s", src);
5030  } else {
5031  success = sfile->Cp(dst, progressbar, buffersize);
5032  }
5033 
5034  if (sfile) sfile->Close();
5035  if (sfile) delete sfile;
5036 
5037  return success;
5038 }
5039 
5040 //______________________________________________________________________________
5041 //The next statement is not active anymore on Linux.
5042 //Using posix_fadvise introduces a performance penalty (10 %) on optimized files
5043 //and in addition it destroys the information of TTreePerfStats
5044 #if defined(R__neverLINUX) && !defined(R__WINGCC)
5045 Bool_t TFile::ReadBufferAsync(Long64_t offset, Int_t len)
5046 {
5047  // Read specified byte range asynchronously. Actually we tell the kernel
5048  // which blocks we are going to read so it can start loading these blocks
5049  // in the buffer cache.
5050 
5051  // Shortcut to avoid having to implement dummy ReadBufferAsync() in all
5052  // I/O plugins. Override ReadBufferAsync() in plugins if async is supported.
5053  if (IsA() != TFile::Class())
5054  return kTRUE;
5055 
5056  int advice = POSIX_FADV_WILLNEED;
5057  if (len == 0) {
5058  // according POSIX spec if len is zero, all data following offset
5059  // is specified. Nevertheless ROOT uses zero to probe readahead
5060  // capabilities.
5061  advice = POSIX_FADV_NORMAL;
5062  }
5063  Double_t start = 0;
5064  if (gPerfStats != 0) start = TTimeStamp();
5065 #if defined(R__SEEK64)
5066  Int_t result = posix_fadvise64(fD, offset, len, advice);
5067 #else
5068  Int_t result = posix_fadvise(fD, offset, len, advice);
5069 #endif
5070  if (gPerfStats != 0) {
5071  gPerfStats->FileReadEvent(this, len, start);
5072  }
5073  return (result != 0);
5074 }
5075 #else
5076 Bool_t TFile::ReadBufferAsync(Long64_t, Int_t)
5077 {
5078  // Not supported yet on non Linux systems.
5079 
5080  return kTRUE;
5081 }
5082 #endif
5083 
5084 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
5085 /// Max number of bytes to prefetch.
5086 ///
5087 /// By default this is 75% of the
5088 /// read cache size. But specific TFile implementations may need to change it
5089 
5090 Int_t TFile::GetBytesToPrefetch() const
5091 {
5092  TFileCacheRead *cr = 0;
5093  if ((cr = GetCacheRead())) {
5094  Int_t bytes = cr->GetBufferSize() / 4 * 3;
5095  return ((bytes < 0) ? 0 : bytes);
5096  }
5097  return 0;
5098 }
